description:
I finally checked out this spot for lunch yesterday. I am glad I did. I'm not really a big Oyster person, but I love seafood. I tried the Ahi tuna steak and the caesar salad with prawns. Both really good picks.

I feel like caesar salads are a underrated art when done really well. 

You can tell this restaurant puts a lot of care and attention into their food. The menu is definitely a little on the pricey side, but they do have happy hour all day from Friday-Sunday, so I will be back for drinks.
author: Cynthia G.

description:
Pretty good place to get oysters in SF. They have happy hour which wasn't exactly super deal but since it happens all day on the weekend so any discounts would still be nice. The HH menu is basically just some 2 dollar oysters and, 6 dollars for a bloody orange cider, and 8 dollars for a glass of wine. There is also premium oysters for $3 each but we chose to opt out.

Among all the 2 dollar oysters we tried, summerset was our favorite, it was flavorful and creamy. 

Awesome place, will definitely go back for more oysters!
author: Jas L.

description:
We came for the oyster happy hours which was reasonably priced, actually it is probably around the same as in other restaurants. I've been to places where they had happy hour for $1 each oyster or $1.5. So this place was $2 for regular oysters and $3 for premium oysters. But honestly, my friends and I couldn't tell the differenced between the oysters but maybe that is because we aren't sophisticated enough.

Don't get me wrong though, the oysters were super fresh and really delicious. The reason I gave this place a 3 star is because their other food items are pretty mediocre but heavily over priced. Everything else on the menu was at least $20 but didn't hit the spot in my defense or satisfied that seafood craving. We had the fish and chips which was $20 and I've had better at the city fish and it was $7.

In the end, we thought the quality was decent but overpriced. So I probably wouldn't return or I'd come here very rarely.
author: Christopher L.

description:
Happy hour all day Friday-Sunday!

What I tried:
*Happy hour oysters 
*Blood orange cider

Overall thoughts:
*Pretty busy on a Friday night. Came here cuz I had a random craving for oysters and this was the first place that still offered happy hour so late in the day. 

*Entrees are more on the pricy side but looks really good. 

*Service was good. We were seated at the bar and my friend was curious about a soju bottle we saw. They ended up giving us a sample.
author: Sarah W.

description:
Great seafood place. 
The area was a little sketchy but this place is clean and neat. All seafoods we got were pretty good. Service was nice, too.
We came here Friday 7pm with 3 ppl. One of my Japanese friend came so we made a reservation here. 
We ordered raw oysters, of course, 2 pieces for each. 2 bottles of wine. calamari which was crispy and good. today's special scallop. shrimp something hm,I don't remember the name but sounds Italian.  all of them were good. especially I liked the scallop.
author: Nazuki Y.

description: I can always count on Mission Oyster Bar for fresh oysters all year round. I love how they have such a large selection of oysters. Prices are great too, their regular oysters are $2 each and $3 for the premium selection. I think I've tried all of their oysters but my favorite has to be the Blue Point. So creamy and fresh. They have a nice wine selection for pairing as well.
author: Lushi Z.

description: I go to this Oyster Bar about twice a month. The wait staff is super friendly. I always like to sit at the bar as there's always a good game on. The oysters are out of this world heavenly. They're so fresh and have quite a nice variety for different types of oysters that you like. The rest of their menu is crazy good. I love their crab cakes. And it's fun that you can see the guys in the kitchen working through the glass window. I wish I lived a little bit closer because if I did I would probably be in there a couple times a week getting my oyster fix.
author: Denise Z.

description: I came here for the $2 oyster happy hour. Premium oysters were still $3 each. We ended up trying most of the different oysters but liked the Kumai, Shigoku, and Kumamoto oysters. I like that the menu has descriptions for how the oysters taste. One of the servers was extremely nice, but another kind of had some attitude which was a little off putting.
author: Lillian B.

description:
A gem for oyster and seafood lovers. 

Located in the Mission district this family operated restaurant works hard at putting out fresh delicious foods, with friendly efficient service in a comfortable clean setting. 

We went there at 7:30 on a Monday evening.  Immediately we were greeted with a smile from the owner's son as he seated us and helped us with our drinks before the waiter arrived. 

The daily oyster menu had 5 varieties of fresh oysters and we got 3 of each. My favorite was the Chesapeake Bay oysters. A bit creamy and briny. Yeeum. Fyi, any month with an "R" in it is good for oysters. Usually the colder months. 

Next we got the Dungeness Crab Cocktail with avocado. Wow the crab meat was sooo fresh and moist.  Super clean and refreshing if you're watching your calories. It was so good we got another order. Obviously we're not counting OUR calories 

The Spicy Shrimp Scampi did not disappoint. Five large shrimp cooked to perfection served with sautéed broccolini, carrots and potatoes. 

But the star of the show was the Fresh Whole Dungeness Crab served in a delicious herbed broth.  The crab was so plumped and fresh and  the meat came easily off the shell. You can tell un-fresh crab because the meat will shrivel inside the shell and when you crack a claw, there is a bit of air space between the meat and shell. This meat was plump and moist. I could've drank the herbed sauce with a straw. 

They have a good wine list and a nice selection of beers. It was a slow Monday night but nevertheless the service was grea

We will definitely be back. 


Happy Eating!!
author: Toan D.

description: Thought it was awsome.....got the happy hour and the oyster shot was good too. We tried every oyster they had....10/10
author: Joseph S.

description: The oysters are amazing, especially with $2 deal. The baked oysters are my fav along with the crab appetizer. Service was amaZing. I hope to try the ciopinno when I go back!
author: Tara K.

description: Can't go wrong with $2 Happy Hour oysters, especially all day on the weekend! We ordered fried calamari, garlic bread, a dozen of the $2 oysters & a dozen of the $3 premium oysters. Everything was delicious. I'm glad I found this little gem on Mission because I will be back! I would definitely recommend!
author: Desiree R.

description: PRICEY!!! It's not all that. I liked that they had a variety of oysters to choose from but that's about it. We tried the rock-a-feller oyster, which usually is my favorite at any restaurant. But I found these ones to be greasy and not good tasting at all. For appetizers the cheapest was a $13 shrimp cocktail and goes up from there for basic appetizers SMH. It's about $25 and up for seafood salad again SMH. and dinner Entrees are about $26 and up. I get it your trying to attract the hippsters in the area and it's working because they are the only ones dumb enough to pay these prices...meanwhile you can go down the street into any burrito spot and get a shrimp cocktail for $8 and it will be the most Delicious thing you've eaten. This place is a thumbs down for me.
author: Jem E.

description:
Ambiance is pretty cool. Really nice selection and variety of oysters..tasted fresh which was great. Had split fish and chips with a friend-it came with 3 cod fillets and skinny fries.

Would come here again.
author: Summer S.

description: Finally got to stop by this place last night. At first, I thought it was to pricey, but found that the portions are huge and the seafood was awesome and fresh. Definitely worth it. I think I found my new favorite place in SF. And our server was the best. Definitely coming back!
author: Naseer A.

description: Just left the restaurant and had to review. I like restaurants that are open a little later which we walked in at 9pm. No problem seated, water right away. We started with oysters and it's awesome they have options for for fresh oysters! Appetizer was fresh and so delicious! Garlic bread and cioppino is what I order and they were in point. Beer was cold, good music and vibe so overall it's a place I'd return to! P.s. in the mission make it feel relatable!
author: Amanda M.

description:
Favorite spot in SF! Oysters are fresh and foods are delicious!  
Happy hours is best bang for your buck $$$
author: Kevin H.

description:
Had a solo dinner there last night. I ordered a plate of five of their $2 oysters, as an appetizer. They were all incredibly delicious and exceedingly fresh tasting. As good as oysters get. They served it with lemon wedges, mignonette, and a traditional cocktail sauce that rocked, due to it's VERY fresh horseradish.  (The cocktail sauce was so good that I finished it with a spoon after I ran out of oysters.)

For my entree, I ordered a stuffed petrale sole. I haven't had that in years. Again, this dish was a home run. The petrale sole was stuffed with small bay shrimp, some sauteed mushroom, onion, etc. The sole was perfectly cooked, with a big of very light browning on the outside which added incredible depth of flavor. The fish was served on a bed of creamy, buttery, flavorful mashed potatoes (nicely seasoned, just the right amount). I was not enthused about the potatoes when they told me that is how they serve it, but honestly, they went together perfectly. There was also a lovely medley of whole carrots, kale, and broccoli. I love vegetables and these were as with everything else, perfectly cooked and delicious.

Given my raving, why did I only give it 4 stars?  The service was a little disjointed and getting my check took a while. Everyone is very nice, but I kept seeing different waiters. The place is very casual, and a nice place for a group meal, a quiet dinner, or a quick detour to get yourself some delicious oysters. Prices were very reasonable for what you get. I can't wait to go back, now that they're on my radar screen. Wish I had found them sooner.
author: Carol M.

description:
great service, great food. The waiter has good suggestions with the night specials.  We had the crab avocado louie salad.  The main entrees 
was surf and turf both cooked perfectly.   We also ate the delicious crab
cakes.
author: Dirk S.

description:
I love oysters! Raw, baked, grilled, fried -I'll have them any way.  However, I hate lining up for food (looking at you Hog Island Oyster Co) so I opted to make reservations at this restaurant instead.  

Upon entering the restaurant, it was almost empty at 530pm.  The waiter seated my girlfriend and I by the window.  Food was great! I think they had oyster happy hour.  Ordered a bottle of white wine and their special of the day -halibut, clam chowder, seafood cioppino.... 

I have to admit, I ended up getting more tipsy than usual by the end of the night (thanks to that unfiltered sake/soju?).  When i woke up the following morning, I couldn't find the credit card I used and forgot how much the bill was.  When I immediately called them after cancelling my card, they couldn't find my card but the waitress was nice enough to send me a photo of the bill with my signature.   

Bottomline:  Very helpful staff and delicious food! Would definitely come back!
author: Jaye L.

description: Came here with a couple of friends and immediately liked the layout of the restaurant.  The food was okay but I wasn't impressed with the portion sizes for the price. I understand that it's sf seafood but there was literally five squares of potatoes on my plate with an interesting "medley" of vegetables.  The crab cakes were the size of scallops.  The Sangria was pretty good but again the tiniest wine glass with a lot of ice for the happy hour $8.  We also had to ask for water four times.  It seemed strange to literally be finished with your food and still not receive water.  They had a lot of moving parts and I think the waiting staff had too many people checking on every table (we literally had three different people assisting us and still water was the last thing brought to the table). Overall I don't think the price is worth the food or service.
author: Lauren G.

description:
Service was great. Oysters- not so much. Went here for oyster happy hour and was highly disappointed. Tried all six oyster types available for HH. I eat oysters all the time and typically can eat at least two dozen. I barely managed to eat 6 oysters here...they tasted like they haven't been properly prepped and also didn't taste fresh. The Miyagi's were dry and shriveled, the rest just weren't up
to par. Whatever else you may eat here- avoid the oysters.
author: Luka D.

description:
BITCHHHHHHHHHHHH.... YES. I had the day off and decided to come to the city for oysters. I came here because it was close to my first stop. 

This place did not disappoint at all. I got 10 oysters, some were $3 and the rest were $2. I did Shigokus, Miyagis, Steamboat & Blue Point. The menu gives you information about them. They were all delicious, probably the best oysters I've had in a while. 
THEY HAVE HAPPY HOUR ON OYSTERS ALL DAY LONG. 

I came here at 3 and it's pretty dead but the staff is super nice & they play great music.
author: Bree H.

description: Fantastic service! I came for happy hour and was not disappointed. $2 for regular oysters, $3 premium. My favorite is the Kumai (reg), Steamboat (reg), Kumamoto (premium), and Shigokus (premium). Service was great. Only complaint is parking, but it's SF so go figure! Highly recommend'
author: Stella N.

description:
Typical San Francisco fare and pricing. I didn't especially have a great or bad time. The food options are limited and my best friend had plenty of drinks.

The oysters are average and nothing to write home about. I've had better oysters at some  Asian Cajun restaurants down in SoCal. Namely, I enjoy grabbing oysters from the Boiling Crab To-Go Brookhurst/Westminster location. They're always extremely clean and fresh with delicious red sauce. (I go elsewhere for crawfish, shrimps and clams: the Wild Crab). 

We enjoyed ourselves, but I'm certainly not in love.
author: Sam H.

description:
Really impressed with this place. Came here before the July 4 holiday as most places were closed. It was happy hour. Ordered dozen oysters and ciopinno which both were incredible. 

Food: oysters. Ordered hh and premium varieties- all amazing. Ciopinno was great- which there was more bread because it was soooo good. 

Drinks: happy hour. Ordered rose and cava. 

Service: friendly, checked on us often

Overall: thumbs up and would 100% go back!
author: Amanda M.

description: Great oysters bar. Has a good variety of west coast oysters, and other seafood on the menu. Service was friendly as well.
author: Michael W.

description:
Met up with two friends after work for happy hour / dinner. They got there about an hour or so before me, so we already had a table for three when I got to Mission Street Oyster Bar last Friday, March 3rd around 6pm.

*Happy Hour Oysters ($1.50 each) x48
*Happy Hour Wine ($6) x6
*Boston Clam Chowder ($6.95 bowl)
*Garlic Bread ($6.95)
*Frutti di Mare ($34.95)
*Gran Sarao Brut Cava, Spain ($9)
*Ice Tea ($3) x2

I believe their HH is until 6pm, so they ordered a bunch of oysters before I got there. I ended up with a dozen. I believe there were six varieties so I got two of each. I also had two glasses of HH wine waiting for me. They were roses. Good, drinkable HH wine. I didn't really try any other food, but it looked pretty good. We actually bumped into Rodney H part way into dinner, so he joined us and helped us finish off the food. I did end our meal with a glass of cava. I liked this more as I like dry sparkling wines.

Fun place for HH oysters. I loved that they offered six varieties as part of their special.
author: Elena N.

description: A nice variety of oysters from all over the west coast. The oysters Rockefeller's were pretty scrumptious. The beer prices for happy hour was pretty crappy. The crab cakes were a tad too sweet to my liking and the price point for them was kind of a rip off. Visually this place has a lot to offer food wise but price wise and the actual taste of the food I wasn't the biggest fan. The Hispanic lady who was the sole worker during my visit did a great job of holding down the business.
author: Marcus M.

description:
This place really should be more crowded. Went there late afternoon on a weekday and only a few other tables.  Everything was prepared perfectly 
. The oysters are a real deal too and were fantastic. We also had their house rose and an anchor steam at happy hr price. The cioppino had enough seafood for two to share and the broth was amazing with the garlic toast.
author: Mary K.

description:
This food is delicious! Point, blank, period. Oysters on point and a nice variety. Happy hour is good price. Crab cakes excellent. Shrimp scampi and mashed potatoes yummy. I enjoyed everything I ate here. Come eat here! You are won't regret it.
 
3rd time here in a week!! All I can say is Shrimp Scampi, shrimp scampi, shrimp scampi. They are back in that kitchen cooking like someone's mama. I never get to show you the plate cause I dig right in. Yes its that good. Get garlic bread on the side and sop up the juice. 

Shaking my head

Thank me later!!
author: Sparkle T.

description: Yesterday:Yummy oysters, many choices and service is good. Few flaw which I can only give 3 star. The 5 piece $17 shrimp which wasn't good was not worth it. The $17 crab cake wasn't all that too. I probably only come here for oysters but the rest no since it's not worth the price.
author: Christy V.

description: Ok mission street gets 2 thumbs up! This place was the bomb. After hitting up att park we ended up here. It was a bookmark of mine forever. It's located in the all so colorful mission. Parking is all on the street and fills up fast when the area is jumping. The good thing for me I came on a Tuesday night the place was fairly empty. We sat down fast and the waiter came over promptly to give us the specials. He also let us know about the 2 dollar oysters all day long. Yeah your boy loves him some oyster they are magical. So we ordered a dozen oysters 2 of each type they had that night. Oyster Rockefeller and a mission special. Everything was on point! I hate that I have not been here sooner. But I definitely will be back. I have to give major props to the bartender and the waiter those guys rock.
author: Tony B.

description: Went here because I was craving fish, but sadly there wasn't a fish dish. However I did get the crab cakes which I thought was mediocre. My boyfriend and I got some raw oysters, let me just say I'm not a fan of raw oysters but I was feeling adventurous. So we ordered some I believe it was called bay point oysters and it was the first oyster that actually went down and it was actually well tasting enough that I had two! My boyfriend had the shrimp skewers not sure how good they were but he ate it all so I'm assuming it's good. But I would recommend this place for their fresh oysters and the varieties of oysters they have.
author: Mey S.

description:
If you find yourself on Mission Street on a Saturday night come here for the oysters and seafood! 

All of the oysters are reasonably priced considering the area. The $3.75 oysters (I forget the type but they change daily) were AMAZING. We also had the clam chowder which was creamy and delicious served with a soft, hot loaf of bread. They have decent beers on tap. I'd come again in a heartbeat for the $2 oyster weekday special.
author: Jessie Elizabeth J.

description:
Had a reservation here with a large group (8) and wasn't super impressed. The food was fine, but was pretty expensive overall (entrees were around $25 across the board: the cheapest I saw was $20 for vegetable pasta).

We had oysters, and I had the clam chowder + crab cakes. The crab cakes (3 total, pretty small) came with potatoes and assorted vegetables, as well as a sauce of some kind which tasted good. The crab cakes themselves were pretty good, but I wasn't a huge fan of the potatoes: they were okay, but not really seasoned in any memorable way. Likewise with the vegetables... just not very exciting. For $25 I really expected more :(

The clam chowder definitely wasn't the best I've had, which was a shame. They also had a minor mixup with our clam chowder orders (cup vs. bowl).

I think the price of everything gave me higher expectations, but even leaving that aside, it was all just 'fine' - not amazing. Maybe I got unlucky and just ordered the wrong stuff. If I came again, I'd probably stick to oysters (which were good, but I'm no expert), and maybe one of their specials - the sole looked nicer than what I ordered.
author: Joe B.

description: Went here for happy hour and the oysters were really good, but then again everything takes better when you pair it with half priced alcohol lol. Seriously this place is good bang for your buck during happy hour, just wish service was a bit better.
author: Kafilat Y.

description:
I don't know why I haven't been here before and why I don't come here more often!

The menu is similar to other good seafood restaurants in SF like Swan Oyster Depot or Anchor Oyster Bar, but it never seems to be quite as busy.

$2 oysters all day Monday to Friday. We could choose from Fanny Bay, Blue Point, Summerset, Steamboat, and Miyagis the day we were here. "Premium" oysters such as Kumamotos, Kusshis, Beau Soileils, and Shigokus were available for $3 each. 

We also had oyster shooters ($4.50 each), a crab meat cocktail ($16.95), and drinks. Everything was delicious.
author: Jean Y.

description: I've made two visits to MSOB now and I will likely visit again. The ALL-DAY Happy Hour is great. You can snag $2 or $3 oysters and $5 beers and be set. I like to sample a variety, the server described them perfectly if you are less a risk taker you can take their advice on which to try, they were all nice and fresh!
author: Melissa H.

description:
The Blue Point oysters were better than the Tomale Bay ones IMHO .  My husband had the cioppino, I didn't try it but he said it could've used more acid.  I liked my sole stuffed but it could've used more acid too.

There's no kids menu, so I ordered a pasta alfredo which my kids split.  The kids also split fried calamari.  Oysters were really good, rest of the menu items were decent, but the customer service was the best part.
author: Maria B.

description:
SHORT AND SWEET, BEST PLACE FOR HAPPY HOUR. 

The oyseters were great, and the food was pretty good. We ordered the fruitt de mare, I've had better, but hey, i was hungry. 

Like I said, we went during happy hour on a Monday, wasn't disappointed at all. And we shall... return.
author: Miguel W.

description: This was my favourite restaurant for my San Francisco trip, oysters were great and price was reasonable !!!! Had good selection of food to choose from and was all great !!! Highly recommend this place !!!
author: Adrian Y.

description:
Everything we had was delicious. The claim cowder(just needed alittle pepper) to the spicy garlic prawns to the amazing ciopino. The garlic bread   was crazy insanely hands down best I've ever had. The happy hour $2 oysters were really good. Very fresh...even after all the lemon and garlic and hot sauce I had to pile on. ( Im new to this oyster eating)

The service was nice. I've been told this place can get crowded fast. Well on a Friday evening is was perfect. So our waiter was very attentive. Even after I had to send back what I ordered.(not what i expected) the manager came over and helped me to better understand the menu, substitutions, favorites. 
Overall great experience. Definitely will be back. 

Cons:
A little expensive.
In the mission area. I don't mind the mission its just not pretty area to look at.
author: Kimbre K.

description: The value here cannot be beat. The servings were humongous and the seafood was super fresh. The servers were very friendly and attentive but not overbearing. The food was slightly under seasoned for my taste hence the docking of a star but otherwise a solid bet.
author: Grace H.

description:
Maybe I'm just jaded. I've tried some pretty great seafood in my lifetime, so the food here was just ok. Not horrible by any means, but I didn't leave here that impressed. I also wouldn't recommend coming here if you're starving, because it is pricey since it's seafood!

We split a seafood gazpachu and I got a tiny cup of clam chowder. Like I said, everything was good but not the best. I usually get full pretty fast, but surprisingly I was hungry again an hour later. Unusual for me and a bummer since I spent good amount on the bill. 

I do have to say that $2 for oysters is a pretty good deal. I didn't try them this time, but if I come back, it will be for a beer and some oysters.
author: Karen R.

description: Fabulous food! We appreciate the happy hour all thru the weekend. The place is open airy and spacious, staff is very friendly they do not rush you!
author: Falguni D.

description:
How can you say no to $2 oysters, all day/night on weekends?! Well let me tell you, my moot court teammates and I couldn't resist. After our long day of competition, a kick back in Dolores Park, and a failed attempt for happy hour at another restaurant in the Mission, our trusty Yelp apps guided us to Mission Street Oyster Bar and we were happy campers!
After our time in Dolores Park and a quick 15min downhill walk, we wanted to grab oysters but originally we were going to another place that my teammate found on Yelp. Since they were full and not taking any more reservations/walkins, we decided to call Mission Street Oyster Bar ahead of time to make sure there were tables available. I asked about a party of 6 and they told us to come on over. We arrived a few minutes after I called, and to our surprise a table was already set for us! 
We went ahead and started with 2 dozen oysters while we reviewed the menu. The waiter kindly explained the different varieties of oysters but there were so many I couldn't even remember which ones were which as we dined! As we went through our first round of oysters, we all decided to get bowls of clam chowder and a serving of garlic bread as well as beers/wines. Their house wines were pretty affordable, but I knew we had a long night ahead and opted for only one glass. The clam chowder was delicious though! There were a lot of goodies inside, and it wasn't too heavy like some other chowders I've had in life. There is also a cup option which is a lot smaller than the bowl, so go with that if you want to try a wider variety of menu items. The garlic bread was decent, but nothing out of the ordinary in my opinion. I'm glad we shared it as a large group because I only wanted a little bit - if I'm on vacation in SF I'd rather have more oysters than more garlic bread!
Service during our meal was decent...waters were filled occasionally, and when we accidentally knocked over a glass of wine someone came by with a big wad of napkins and helped clean up the spill. Though I didn't actually use it, there is also a restroom inside and my teammates that did go said it was decent as well. 
Our dining experience ended after a few more rounds of oysters (because really, how could you not?!) and by then most of us were pretty oystered out. Our server let us split our check three ways, which was very helpful! 
Thanks to Mission Street Oyster Bar for accommodating our large party and offering great oyster deals! I'll for sure be back during my future SF adventures. 

TL;DR - walkable from Dolores Park, skip the garlic bread, and $2 oysters all weekend!
author: Jasmine W.

description: I ubered from Palo Alto to try this popular oyster restaurant because I love oysters! (I have 24-36 oysters each time at least twice a week) While all staff at the restaurant was super nice and reasonable, oyster was just not up to par. There was one oyster that smelled and tasted rotten z(it would get you in the hospital)  I can still feel it even after a few hours. The restaurant was nice enough to make me pay for just the oysters I ate (12/24) and waved 2 glasses of happy hour wine but it still leaves a bad taste in my mouth.  It's really unfortunate I had paid uber $70 one way to get there and another $80 back.
author: Susan P.

description: For happy hour Oysters away from the buzz this is as good as any. You have choice of regular $2 which on the day we went there were 5 types ranging from mold & buttery (Blue Point WA) to salty &a juicy (miyagis Tomale Bay). There's also a premium $3 option which includes kumomotos. I enjoyed the $5 special of anchor steam draft, while my wife enjoyed her $7 pino grigio.
author: Andrew T.

description: Roach crawling on the wall while we ate dinner. My husband and I came here last night for dinner and based on the great reviews were expecting a nice meal. The oysters were good. But in the middle of dinner a roach crawled on the wall right by our table. I couldn't finish my meal. Gross.
author: Mary S.

description: I love Mission Street Oyster Bar.  Great selection of oysters and any other seafood you can think of. The seafood is served in good basic recipes kicked up a notch, and everything we had that visit was excellent, including the oysters, grilled shrimp skewers, a salad.  Portions were generous. They have a good wine list as well.  Could not figure out why there were so few people there, but it was early on a weeknight.  I hope they get the business they deserve. Visit this place for excellent seafood.
author: Lindsay D.

description:
I would sell my soul to the devil for this pasta ..

I would sell my soul to the devil for this pasta ..

I would sell my soul to the devil for this pasta ..

I would sell my soul to the devil for this pasta ..

I would sell my soul to the devil for this pasta ..

I would sell my soul to the devil for this pasta ..
author: Breona R.

description: Nice place. Seating always available able. Happy hour Monday thru Friday all day!! $2 dollar oysters!
author: Ramie S.

description: The food and service was amazing. One of the top meals I've ever had. I ordered the prawn scampi and it had incredible flavor with fresh herbs and garlic. The quality of the prawns and veggies were superb. I took my mother and sister and they loved their meals as well. The restaurant was clean and welcoming. I'll definitely be back.
author: Brandi T.

description: Great food, service, and atmosphere! We'll definitely be back.  They didn't have the artichokes,  but the oysters and gazpacho were delicious.  The crab was the best we've had in a while.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
The decor is simple, cold, and dated. Diner vibe. Bussing tubs, back well and shelves stocked with everything from Cola cans to napkins, sugar packets, and ketchup bottles can be seen in plain sight from almost anywhere in the restaurant. It's usually pretty quiet, sometimes a stoned crazy would stroll in but don't mind them because they are harmless and don't stay for long. 

I come once a month to treat myself with fresh, shucked-to-order oysters. The descriptors are just guidelines. Palates will change after a sip of wine. A "briny" oyster may taste sweet after a sip of Riesling. Sizes vary depending on season and delivery as well. 

The service is very polite. Different people every time. Quick turnaround? Steps of advice is lacking but only friendly people are hired here. 

Overall, I know what to expect. I come back when I can when I have oyster cravings. Worth a try or two.
author: Madison K.

description: Their oysters are incredible amazing and fresh, however we do not like our entree that much, I mean is okay, but it is little bit expensive. We ordered 15 oysters and two meals which cause us to pay 100 dollars for two people.
author: Gloria Y.

description: This was a great place to eat for my first time! I had the shrimp scampi and my gf had the spicy shrimp. Both dishes were very flavorful and delicious. I will definitely be back to try something else on the menu
author: Slim G.

description: Delicious seafood, a variety of oysters from all over.  Our server was extremely knowledgeable about the different types of oysters.  Really great find would highly recommend.  I started with a couple oysters on the half shell then had the baked scallops special with mashed potatoes and vegy's.  Superb. The neighborhood was a little sketchy and we weren't quite sure if we were at the right spot but we were and it was very memorable and tasty.
author: Jenny G.

description: Service was super friendly and fast. Plenty of oysters to choose from. All were awesome!
author: Saynatry P.

description: Cool little place .... went to SF and didn't want to eat at a high end and pay like 15$ for one oyster. Found this place thanks to yelp. Make sure you go when it's happy hour  all food is good and tasty. I've been here twice and I'd go back when I visit again
author: Janice A.

description: Love the selection of oysters. Shrimp pasta with tomato cream sauce was delicious. Happy hour M-F 4-10pm $2 Oysters (premium oysters are $3).  Select beer and wine on happy hour $5. Fried shrimp was awesome. Fried calamari and oysters were alright. Wasn't a fan of the clam chowder.  Definitely will be back to try more.
author: Priscilla S.

description: My family and I came here for Mother's Day. I was excited to indulge in oysters. Gladly, I wasn't disappointed. The oysters were perfection; fresh, clean, meaty, tasty, and big. For $2 a piece, I happily ordered a dozen. My family ordered other dishes consisting of pasta and shrimp, which were also delicious. The staff was friendly and welcoming. Our server was very easy-going, nice, and gracious. He was kind and patient towards our three kids.  I wish that I remembered his name because he should be acknowledged. He looked Latino, big smile, and pony tail. I don't live in the area, but I'll most definitely recommend this place and come again in the future.
author: Elizabeth D.

description: Solid food, just grungy location unfortunately. They had kuushii and kumamoto oysters which were a part of their more expensive premium set, which were good. The broth that comes with their sampler was really excellent for dipping and had a lemon, salt and garlic mix. The cioppino was solid and we had their marinara blend. The garlic crab was pretty decent, I'd say that crustaceans is massively better. Good wine selection starting at $20 per bottle. Location-wise, this part of the Mission feels very run down so it's unusually placed
author: Young Y.

description:
Excellent service (thank you Felix!) and delicious food, especially the cioppino ... 

BUT I don't expect to return to this restaurant. By 6 pm the half-filled dining room was already intolerably, painfully loud. Customers (members of my own party included) were forced to raise their own voices louder and louder just to hear our dining companions over the shrieking din. I can't imagine what it's like when the place is actually full.

My friends, independent of me, came to the same conclusion: Great food, but none of us will return unless they do something to dampen the sound.
author: John M.

description: Kiddos to the guys working tonight (5/10). They were so freaking helpful, friendly, everything. The oysters were amazing, but the bartenders/servers were incredibly friendly and amazing.
author: Stefani C.

description: Enjoyed the fresh clam chowder. Chowder was not a typical heavy cream new England chowder. Instead it's a fresh clam, clam juice and light chowder that has amazing flavor. The fresh garlic bread was a bonus! The owners are friendly and dedicated to ensure your experience is exceptional
author: Julie D.

description: So glad to have stumbled upon this restaurant. Their oysters are always fresh and the cioppino is a must order! This is the place we go to for seafood stew and whenever we have guest, we are sure to bring them here. Good range of oysters, best of all, they have happy hour till 8pm!
author: Kelly W.

description:
Family Easter dinner today.  Food wasn't bad for the price except the menu item listed as stuffed avocado but was just crab dumped carelessly dumped on sliced avocado.  
They had maybe three people working and this hurt the quality of service.
Solid 3.5 stars.  - .5 star because they pull the stunt on the receipt to get you to tip on the post tax amount.  Seriously, people, food is getting expensive enough as it is and diners will tip property for service but it seems like it is just so intentional when they wont show you a pre tax total on the receipt.
author: Scott F.

description:
We don't mess around around. We love oysters and were determined to get oyster-wasted on my last night in town. 

Remember my fun oyster shopping experience at Sun Fat Seafood Company (http://www.yelp.com/biz/sun-fat-seafood-company-san-francisco?hrid=xupN2YDs8PNGFuC-0xVi-w&utm_campaign=www_review_share_popup&utm_medium=copy_link&utm_source=(direct))? 
Mission Street Oyster Bar happened just 30 mins after that. 
With our fresh live oysters bagged & tagged, we walked down a few blocks to the MSOB for happy hour oysters & wine. Oyster pre-gaming at its best. 

* Open Monday thru Sunday 12:00 P.M. to 10:00 P.M.

* Happy Hour:
- M-F $1.50 oysters from 12:00 P.M. to 6:00 P.M.
- Sat-Sun $2.00 oysters ALL DAY!

They have 5 varieties of oysters daily. These were the specials just for that day:

FANNY BAY: Meaty larger oysters with a nice milky smooth finish. It's a bit firmer than your kumies or miyagi oysters, but still fresh tasting with a light crisp finish.

CHESAPEAKE BAY: Sweet and creamy. Not very briny but still tasty.

KUMAMOTO: These small but plump kumies are one of my favs to eat. Buttery succulent fruity flavor that resembles a mix of cucumbers and honeydew melon. Just lovely!

BLUE ROCK POINT: Medium-sized oysters that is great for oyster noobs. I just like that it's nice and salty.

MIYAGI: Up there as my other favorite with the kumamoto oyster. Mildly briny and just perfect with a squirt of lemon. 

We chose to start off with the 10 mix ($15, $1.50 each). We just wanted to sample 1 each before deciding which ones to order more of for the next round.
http://bit.ly/1MXku2u

Enjoyed every one of them so we repeatedly the same order for our 2nd platter, but added 2 additional Miyagi Oysters to make it a full dozen ($18). 
http://bit.ly/1LFVzyw

CALAMARI ($13.95): 
There was a good amount of calamari rings but only a couple pieces of tentacles (the best part!). The crispy thing batter had a terrific crunch, while the calamari still retained its tenderness on the inside. 
http://bit.ly/1PjPE9Y
- Served with a rich tangy tartar sauce and house cocktail sauce. My friend and I both preferred the tartar sauce, since the cocktail sauce was blah without the much needed horseradish.

We each had a couple rounds of their happy hour wines to go along with our oysters. 

 Tempranillo ($6): My friend Kiko loves her reds so our server suggested she try a more diverse food-pairing wine to go along with our meal since we're having oysters and fried calamari. It's mildly acidic with hints of cherries and plum. She loved it so much that she asked for another one.

House white ($7): I just got a chardonnay. Just a clean, crisp white wine to go with my freshly-shucked oysters. Yep, I'm boring like that. Step.

Service was fast and food was delicious as expected with fresh oysters. We would've stayed longer to try out more items but we still had our poor oysters & clams in bags sitting next to us from Sun Fat Seafood Company......fearfully awaiting their fate when they got home. Poor little guys had to hear us gushing and savoring their bivalve cousins the entire time. We're terrible. I'm probably going to hell.
author: Cin T.

description:
I LOVE this place.

I dropped by around 7:15 on a Saturday night with a fellow seafood loving friend, and luckily there was no wait. People continued to come in throughout the night, but it wasn't anything too nutty, and reservations are probably not necessary.

We started with a dozen oysters with 6 different varieties, and each was fresh, delicious, and very distinctive. For the meal, we shared a cioppino, and I loved it. It was really flavorful and fresh, and it was perfect for a cold night in the Mission. The portion doesn't look like a lot, but it was super filling and had tons of yummy seafood inside. Not to be outdone by the shrimp and crab inside the stew, the garlic bread was equally amazing. Totally tempted to order extra bread next time.
author: Kelly R.

description: Ordered combination cocktail, crab, and oysters. Everything was delicious and the service was great! The seafood was fresh and had lots of taste, id say is well worth the price. Our server was really nice. The garlic bread was a must with the crab! 10/10 would recommend and well worth the trip out here!
author: Tianna C.

description: Great Happy hour.  Their oysters are so fresh and the staff is great.  Perfect for a mid-week treat or go on the weekend and have a lazy brunch.  I normally get the combo which is amazing comes with 12 oysters, Steamed clams and 4 prawns.  This makes the perfect mid afternoon bite!
author: Natalie K.

description: Def hidden gem in the Mission district. So much yumminess! Everything we ordered was perfectly delicious. Seafood gazpacho and prawns cocktail were our appetizers and it was oh so good. We had oysters with sake and beer. I forget the oysters we ordered but I loved it. AMAZING! The Cioppino was the best I ever tried. Must try when you come here! If you live around here, must try for oysters and seafood.
author: Janice P.

description: So yummy. This is a great place. Love the waiters, they are so nice and helpful. Fresh and tasty seafood
author: Katherine H.

description:
Beware of thieves!!  My handbag with my wallet, phone etc got stolen from here on Friday night. When I alerted the staff, they were really unhelpful and borderline rude.  They said that they had noticed a guy acting strangely standing beside us (but they hadn't thought to signal that to us at the time). They also said the video cameras pointing right at us were broken. In relation to the things that were taken, I was told by a waiter, 'well we all have nice things'. They didn't help search for the bag, they didn't alert or ask other customers if they saw anything, they didn't ask if I was ok, if there was anything they could do to help or even offer a glass of water as I tried to figure things out. Their only concern was making sure that I didn't leave the restaurant with my friend without paying the bill. Shockingly poor customer service.
Two stars because the food was pretty nice, but other than that it was a truly horrible experience.
author: Gina C.

description:
Three of us went here for dinner on Saturday night. It was not crowded so we were seated immediately. We had been here once before so we knew what we wanted.
We ordered a dozen fresh oysters on ice which were great.
For entrees, I had the pasta with shrimp in a light tomato cream sauce. The sauce was delicious and there were lots of large shrimp.  We all liked the garlic toast!
My companions both had the frutti de mare which was filled with clams, mussels, crab, white fish and large shrimp.
I also had a lemonade while they had white wines.
This restaurant is great and we will return many more times!
author: Philip C.

description:
So I was really excited to go to this place as the reviews were great and the photos were promising. I have to say that the service was exceptional... Friendly, fast, and attention to detail.. BUT

The oysters were NOT good. I eat them all the time and love them.. right now I'm sitting at home sick to my stomach. OH, and 15$ for two TINY crab cakes? Delicious but way too expensive.
author: Vicky W.

description:
I accompanied my gf bc she loves oysters. They had a selection of oysters at great prices during happy hour. I believe she had the Miyagis, Steamboats ,and Fanny bays oysters 

I had the fries , they too were delicious lol.
author: Steven L.

description: I live in the Mission and just happened to stumble upon this place and OMG I am so glad I did! If you're looking for fresh oysters, bomb pasta & friendly/quick service, this is THE SPOT!
author: Brenda E.

description:
Eh. I came in on a late weekday afternoon to check this place out.

When I sat at the bar, there were only about 3 other patrons spread out and only a few tables filled.

It took a little bit for the bartender to acknowledge me and she gave off vibe that she didn't want to be there. And then she went to help out a table that came in after me first. Arrrrr! 

I ended up ordering the happy hour wheat beer and about a half dozen oysters. The oysters just didn't taste that good and weren't very fresh. I was getting worried that I might have problems later.

This place ain't cheap either. When you check out the other menu items, be ready to pony up some bread. Speaking of which, it appeared like they would charge you for bread!

I should've checked with my Yelp favorites because most of them gave this place a subpar review too.
author: Art O.

description: Delicious meal! Came with my entire family for a pre wedding get together.  The staff was fantastic and made sure we had a wonderful meal.  We stayed for quite a while maybe almost 3 hours and they were attentive and pleasant and great.  More importantly omg we sampled the entire menu and there wasn't anything t hat was not just absolutely delicious.  WILL COME AGAIN
author: Margo B.

description: Food was good but not wow! The happy hour is definitely worth it and the atmosphere is welcoming and friendly. Lots of conversations, music and interesting shoes on tv. I didn't like that you had to pay for bread and butter and felt the portions were not as big as their prices. I would come back for the happy hour...with friends.
author: Michelle B.

description:
Great seafood, with a great oyster selection. The oysters are a reasonable price. Not so cheap that you can go oyster crazy, but still, reasonable. 

They have a huge wine selection, but you can also see two boxes of Vella wine, white and red, respectively, on prominent display in the kitchen which is viewable through the wall windows. This made me reconsider ordering wine here.

I have nothing against boxed wine, in fact I find it quite delicious, especially for gatherings, but having it visible from where I'm eating makes me wonder about how their wine is. Personally I wouldn't trust any bottle here that isn't opened in front of you.

Drink selection is mostly wine that's on the pricier side. So this wouldn't be the place to drink, but definitely a place to get some seafood as well as oysters. Can't recommend the oysters enough, and this is coming from someone who used to serve oysters for a living. Their local choices have been absolutely delicious. If they have the Miyagi oysters from nearby, get them while you have a chance.
author: Mike P.

description: Who knew you could find such great seafood in the heart of the mission! Here's what you gotta do: walk in on a Saturday afternoon and order 8 oysters, all styles, for $2 each. Then get the spicy garlic prawns, in my opinion the best item on the menu. We didn't have drinks there but the bar layout looked awesome. Nice place and will probably come back again.
author: Joe D.

description:
Everything I ate was great! Oysters were small and sweet, combo salad was full of seafood and big, pasta was tasty and filled with huge shrimp and had a little kick to it. It has a bar and TV if you wanna catch a game. $2 oysters all day everyday!

Staff was friendly and attentive. The owner/manager was there and it was nice of him to check in with us! I will definitely be going back!!!!
author: Krystal T.

description: Found this place on Yelp. Great variety and prices for fresh oysters. Also had the world famous garlic crab. Don't know much it will be until we see the bill. Definitely worth the trek here. The garlic bread was yummy too. We made reservations but didn't need for opening time on a Saturday.
author: Linda Y.

description: SAVE YOUR MONEY, eat somewhere else! Oysters are small, veggies are under cooked and food is subpar. There are better places to eat in this city. From one foodie to another, don't waste your time and money here!!
author: June L.

description:
The intro on this place is it's the chef that worked at Anchor over on Castro St. but not as expensive. I don't give many ratings less than 4 stars. 

Everything that wasn't an app on the menu was about $23 bucks. I guess that 4 dollars less than the other place? But everything cost a lot!! The Caesar salad was $13 bucks. 

It's an ok clean looking casual restaurant on Mission, amongst a lot of very cheap store fronts and garbage. I'm not too worried about the junk around it unless you're going to make more cost more than it should be - and this is the place. 

We started with a platter listed as shrimp, oysters, and calamari - lightly fried, because that's what my newly 50 yr old friend wanted. Cool - it came out as a pile of over cooked calamari, 2 shrimps, and 2 charcoaled oysters (so cooked there was black burnt crust on it). Well - The one SHRIMP I ate was Excellent. But for $22 bucks it's way too much calamari - how about we skip 25 calamari rings and get a couple more shrimp on the place - very disappointed and I told Mellow (sp?), our cheerful waitress about it - she handled it well. 

I also bought the garlic bread for $6.50 - and it was very good. And the table beside us had this delicious smelling spicy marinara, - may I have a ramekin of that to dip the garlic toast in - absolutely, for $4.50 you can have some. I went for it - and it was Excellent - maybe even worth the 4.50. I just start feeling nickel and dimed. Do you want to charge me for a piece of lemon too? 

There was this other guy working with Mello (sp?) and he had a very Sour attitude which sure as hell didn't help our experience. 

Waitress was great. One shrimp was delicious and I can recommend the spicy marinara sauce and garlic bread. so I'm bumping up one star.
author: Rew C.

description:
Made reservation here for a Saturday night but place wasn't extremely so didn't really need to. $2 oysters is actually such a great deal. We started out with half a dozen and then ordered 4 more. They have premium oysters for 3 dollars as well. Oysters were bomb!!! Sf really has some good ones. I had a creamy one, forgot the name but didn't like the creamy texture so much but it was still very good. Also had the chips and fish. Fish was fried to perfection. 

Service was on the slow side. But I wasn't in a hurry so wasn't too unhappy about that. But still waiters could've picked things up a bit faster since it wasn't even that packed. 

Would definitely come back for the oysters!!!
author: Caitlin P.

description: First time going here as a seafood rookie and the food and service were great! Our server explained everything to us and graciously answered all of our questions and made excellent recommendations. Definitely try the cioppino, but order extra bread as two isn't enough .
author: Zahida S.

description: Everything I've ordered here is amazing. Oysters are delicious, and they serve 5-6 different kinds. Their crab Caesar salad is no joke. It comes with a huge mound of crab meat. I wasn't expecting such a large serving so I was thrilled. Spicy prawns were cooked perfectly, and not overly spicy. And the garlic crab was also outstanding. Make sure to order the garlic bread to soak up any flavors left on your plate. Excellent and attentive service. 5 stars!
author: Leo G.

description: Service was so-so. Oyster was good. My two girlfriends and I haven't seen each other over a year and decided to meet here. After eating Oysters here, one of us headed back to Australia, one to Mexico for vacation and I stayed local. And all three of us were food poisoned the day after. Ruined all of our Christmas plans.
author: Helen L.

description:
Everything in this place is amazing! The oysters are fresh, very good price and many options.
We had the avocado and crab, simply fabulous, the salad is made with supremo italiano virgin oil which was fabulous and finally... the best cioppino in town! Fresh, abundant, herby and sooo satisfying! Definitely made with love and dedication.
My Paso robles Viognier was perfect!
And the service is the best...
A gem in the mission
Will be back for more! Possibly for oyster happy hour during the week
author: ally s.

description: My friend and I got two dozen oysters. Bartender was so friendly and attentive! He recommended Miyagi, Kumo something or another, and beau yadi yada. Lol clearly not names I've heard of or can pronounce. The B one was the best. So smooth and clean as described. Did not taste any of the aftertastes listed but didn't bother me none. Will definitely try other ones next time. Also the shuckers are obviously experienced. Probably only had two tiny pieces of shell out of my dozen. Can't wait until next time
author: x'tine w.

description:
Mission Street Oyster Bay doesn't skimp when it comes to fresh crab on their crab salad. Unlike most places which douse crab in excessive icky mayonnaise  - Mission Street Oyster Bar let's their crab shine.

Though the rest of the salad here was basic and simple - and I decided to opt out of dressing - preferring to add my own - I really enjoyed my salad from Mission Street Oyster Bar and I would order it again if pining for some fresh crab.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description:
I work in the Mission and had no idea about this amazing place! We walked in at 6pm on a friday night and were seated right away. The service was great. I actually only wanted oysters, but ended up being really impressed with the food. We ordered the two items most reviews recommended- the cioppino and pasta with prawns. 

The cioppino was the best cioppino Ive ever had and Im not over exaggerating either. The amount of seafood was more than generous. The portion was perfect for 2 people- maybe even 3 because we had left overs. But it would definitely be way too much for 1 person. It comes with 2 pieces of delicious garlic bread, but I guarantee youll have to order more to dip in that cioppino. A half order of garlic bread is 2 pieces and a full is 4. Do yourself a favor and just get a full order. 

The daily pasta w/praws with the roasted garlic, white wine sauce was also delicious! I never usually finish pasta entrees but this one I did. The size of the praws were huge and there were maybe 8 pieces. This pasta really exceeded my expectations.

We ordered Fanny Bay Oysters and I have to admit that of all the places Ive ordered these, this place had the biggest fanny bays Ive ever had. They were very meaty!

It was our first time at this restaurant and was even going to order a Calamari but our server was kind enough to warn us that we had plenty of food already with the cioppino and should hold of. Im glad she did that because we didnt even finish the cioppino. 

My server told us this place has been open about 2.5 years but had just went through a renovation. The sign outside was changed and its been attracting a lot more business. Well it worked for me because I always saw their sign on my way to Boba Guys. When we stepped out of the restaurant, we literally heard 3 different couples walking by saying "Oh cool, whats this Oyster Bar?". Obviously, the new sign and renovation was just what this place needs. 

I really didnt expect much from this place because I havent heard much about this place, but my experience totally exceeded my expectations. I have to admit, as I first sat down I decided that if I was still hungry and not satisfied with the food here I would head over to Hog & Rocks after. Well, I sure didnt need to do that! I will definitely be back for more!

Cioppino
Pasta with praws
Full order garlic bread
Fish & Chips ( I cant review this because this wasnt for me and I ordered this for take out)
2 diet cokes (Btw no refills, they are cans)

Total $138
author: Sarina A.

description:
Baby I like it RAW!!!
Came in for a quick mini bite before brunch.
Happy hour M-F 12-6p 1.50 Oysters
Sat-Sun 2.00 Oysters
Quick service
Setting is small but ready to serve Seafood
Expect to see a variety of chowders, prawns, cioppino, calamari, crab oysters, and crab cakes.
Pricey but what do you expect? It's fresh, too bad I only had the combination salad split between 4 others and oysters. 
I'm hoping to try out more items on the menu very soon.
author: Kathy V.

description:
Been twice, once for oysters and once for dinner. The oysters were pretty good, I think they were more than $2 apiece though.

Dinner was disappointing though. Clam Chowder was not cooked very well (celery was almost crunchy and the potatoes pretty hard) and there wasn't much flavor in the broth. Fish/Chips were just okay. The Cioppino was actually pretty tasty, the base was quite good, but at little pricey at $35.

Service was fine. They weren't very busy and I feel like we waited a while to order, get served, and leave. Someone may have been in training as they offered to get us drinks (when we'd already put an order in), but they couldn't take our food order.

Might swing in for oysters again sometime but would probably get dinner elsewhere.
author: Tmon B.

description: Oysters are perfect but the crab and the cIoppinno was my favorite in the city, the bread is the closer!
author: Shannon M.

description:
Oyster happy hour is def one of my fave kinds of happy hours! Mission Oyster has great happy hour specials EVERY day (M-F: $1.50 oysters from 12pm-6pm // Sat-Sun: $2 oysters all day). They have 5 varieties of oysters for happy hour, along with higher-priced varieties available.

All the oysters we tried were well-shucked and tasty. The Sweetwater, Effingham, and Fanny Bay oysters were my favorites (in order). I also liked the minionette and cocktail sauce they provided.

Nice beer and wine selection. Friendly service. I will definitely come back!
author: Vivian H.

description:
It's really refreshing to see generous portion sizes. Nowadays, most restaurants must think we all eat like birds. The food here was cooked to perfection. The taste isn't the best I've had but the portion size and reasonable prices makes up for it.

We had $1.50 oysters (HH, M-F until 6pm). For their happy hour, you don't have to sit at the bar. Another plus for them. 

Local petrale sole was stuffed with a generous amount of crab and shrimp. It was cooked right so it was still moist. The cioppino was huge and full of seafood. What I really loved about it is that it's topped with crab meat so you don't have to deal with the shell.

Service was friendly and on point.

Great local joint for seafood. Will be back very soon!
author: Andy W.

description:
Great choice for seafood that is reasonably priced and great selection! I was staying in the Mission area and needed a place that was close and fast since we had a plane to catch in a few hours.

When our group of six walked in around 2 p.m. on a Sunday, it was pretty quiet and there were only a few tables. My sister was worried, but I wasn't! 

We ordered 2 dozen oysters (combo) to start. They had one Bay Area one, one from Vancouver and 3 from the east coast. All were fresh and briny. 

What else we ordered:

1. Seafood gazpacho: On a hot day, this dish is refreshing and bright. Enough chunks of seafood but good bites of cucumber and other veggies! 
2. Cioppino: the best dish on our table! It can easily feed 2 people. Big chunks of fish, crab and other yummy seafood. The broth is best soaked up with their delicious garlic bread.
3. Spicy Garlic Prawns: Large shrimpy garlicky goodness. Pretty straightforward. 
4. Calamari: nothing special - but solid.
5. Steamed Clams: Clams in a white wine sauce.

If you're looking for an overall seafood restaurant without breaking the bank, this place is fantastic!
author: Calily B.

description: Great service but disappointing food, unfortunately.  The garlic bread and oysters were fine, but the Ahi tuna special was just so-so, and the fish and chips were just bad.  Don't get the fish and chips.  $100 after tip for two people was too steep for this place.
author: Simon L.

description: The oyster happy hour (M-F 12p-6p) is good.  You get to choose from a few different varieties which is great and unlike most spots.  They were certainly fresh and delicious.  The problem lies in the fact that they were out of numerous things, the service was mediocre, and the location and atmosphere are below average.  If you're nearby during the week and craving oysters, stop in.
author: Mike D.

description:
Good, solid oyster place that does not get as busy as many others around the city. In fact, it was quite empty when my boyfriend and I stopped by on a Sunday afternoon. We were craving oysters and saw their weekend happy hour deal. They serve $1.50 oysters Monday through Friday and $2.00 oysters on the weekend. Not bad! 

There are some oyster bars that serve dinky pieces of crap because they charge less for the oysters, but this place served their regular-sized and similarly delicious tasting oysters that they normally would. Perfectly paired with an IPA. They have a few other notable things on their menu that I'll be coming back to try, but really, what a great way to spend a spontaneous Sunday afternoon!
author: Stefanie C.

description:
Came here Saturday night with a friend and really enjoyed my time here.

They had $2 oysters all day on a Saturday which was really nice.  When you order a dozen, they give you a pretty nice assortment of oysters.

We also tried the fries and calamari, but we're unimpressed.  They lacked flavor really, but the delicious oysters made up for that.

Mimosas were also good and service was top notch.

I would love to try an entree next time, but I think I've found a good weekend oyster place for sure.
author: BizzyLizzy K.

description: A nice sized little restaurant in the Mission with a great ambiance and super friendly staff! They have $2 happy hour oysters (a few varieties ) all day long and their more premium  oysters start at $3. Went here on Thursday around 7:30 and it wasn't super packed. Originally came here to try the clam chowder (this place was on a few lists of best clam chowder) and it was nice and meaty. However they don't do the bread bowls. Also was a first timer with the oysters and our waiter was funny, friendly, and able to make recommendations and how to's.
author: Shayna G.

description: A couple things. First, I went with my family of 7 and they sat us very rapidly which was a great start to the best service we have had in San Fran this far. However, the prices were very steep and some of the pictures they presented on their website are not accurate.  Secondly, I ordered the fish and chips which turned out to be disappointing for $20 but my sisters both ordered the pastas with shrimp and that looked amazing. That said, I am a sucker for penne noodles with creamy sauce.
author: Brendan L.

description: Perfect spot for low key delicious seafood. Service was great. Had the linguini with prawns. It was the pasta of the day. Highly recommend it
author: Dave H.

description: Awesome happy hour - $1.25 oysters and $4 beers! Came here on a weekday and there was no wait. The service was fast and friendly. The oysters were excellent as was the fried calamari. Will be back when I'm in SF!
author: Christine D.

description: Omg! This food was amazing! Cioppino was absolutely the best! Gracious portions, seriously! French fries perfectly fried, oysters.. oysters, the oysters were $2 each on the weekend!  I'm so happy right now. Licked my plate- not really, but wanted to.
author: Jackie S.

description:
One of my favorite places in SF for seafood. The wait can be long (~45 mins on a Wed night), but the cioppino was absolutely delicious.

Confession: I had never had cioppino before eating here, and now I'm addicted. It's the kind of dish that is balanced in flavor--the tomato and spices compliment the seafood--without being too overwhelming. I'm not a huge fan of spicy food, but luckily the cioppino is more spiceful than spicy. 

Run don't walk to Mission Street Oyster Bar. It's a neighborhood favorite, and I totally see where the praise comes from.
author: Irene C.

description: Freddy takes care of you at this oyster restaurant. He made great suggestions and made us feel so welcome. The "store" is casual and comfortable. You will be super happy you chose this fun spot. Ask for Freddy.
author: Terri J.

description: I was in town for business and came across this place first off it was one of the cleaner restaurants in the area. The staff was polite and professional, food didn't take long and it was pretty good. Service could of been a tad better but overall we enjoyed our visit.
author: Mo J.

description: One of the good spots in SF if you're looking for oysters.  Enjoyed the fanny boy and blue point.  Also awesome service.  I definitely recommend this place.
author: Chris R.

description:
Came here w/ my 83 yrs old aunt to celebrate her birthday together.  She want crab so we ordered some 'Happy Hours' oysters(@ $1.50 ea) and their popular ciopino. 
Oysters (3 diff. kinds) came out very fresh and tasty, and the seafood ciopino was awesome (crabs, fish, prawns, lots of clams). Service good and friendly.  Both me and aunt left happy!!!
author: Denis Y.

description: Different choices for fresh oysters. Clean and nice services. Not too crowded like other busy restaurant at Valencia. Good choice for family and friends.
author: L C.

description: What's not to like about pristine fresh seafood perfectly cooked? Scallops rate as some of the best I have had.
author: T M.

description:
The hidden gem of the Mission. Oysters are always fresh, the wine and beer selection rotates and is always quality and the garlic bread is divine. 

My favorite entrees are the spicy garlic prawns and the cioppino. Both are serious business.

The best part about this place is that I've never had trouble getting a seat upon walking in.
author: Ian T.

description: My husband and I visited this place on friday night. I did find it quite expensive for what they offered and for where they're located which is not touristy.  Oysters were good tho...
author: Jimena M.

description:
I have been searching for an affordable, laid back (meaning not snobby or touristy) seafood joint for a while, and finally had the chance to try this place out. YUM!! It was soo good. Everything we had was delicious: scallop special, drunken shrimp, cioppino, oysters, mussels, garlic bread to die for.

Service was excellent and bill (with tip) was only $250 for 6 people!
author: Anna K.

description:
When I saw a for-reals seafood restaurant on Mission, I scratched my head. Now it could have been the bugs that may have infiltrated my scalp taking the 14 next to a sanitation-challenged passenger or maybe I was getting his dandruff by osmosis. But I just knew it was time for me to get off the bus and give it a try. I have to admit I got a little nervous since there was only one customer in the whole place at 7PM. Did people know something I didn't about the fish served here? Maybe even the guy with the dandruff and the gnat battalion knew. Nevertheless, I threw caution to the wind and stayed. Lots of shellfish on the menu and appetizers (photo: http://bit.ly/1ywM8Nm)

And what's a classic seafood menu without a shrimp cocktail? Oh there it is. So of course, I asked the waitress what she recommended. Without hesitation, she said the Cioppino. I must get the Cioppino. Of course, it's the most expensive item on the menu. What does she take me for?... so I ordered the $32.95 Cioppino. But before I get into that, let me tell you about the $4.25 cup of Boston Clam Chowder I ordered. Thick and creamy enough to cut with a knife. Believe it or not, I prefer it a little watery since it tastes closer to the sea that way, but I wasn't complaining except they charge extra for bread and butter. Good thing it came with two baggies of oyster crackers which I used as a crunchy topping (photo: http://bit.ly/1xUgv0U).

So finally the Cioppino. A big flat bowl arrived with a pair of crusty garlic toast wedges on top. The rich red broth was slopping over the edge as there was an aquarium of shellfish: little neck clams, manila clams, mussels, huge prawns, crab legs, squid rings. All of it festooned with lemon slices and pepper (photo: http://bit.ly/11kTiJE). Pretty darn delicious though quite a chore to get through all the shells without getting the requisite bib. I'm the type that needs a bib for egg drop soup. I'm a splasher. For the plethora of bivalves and such, it was still no Swan Oyster Depot when it came to freshness, and I have to admit even the big bowl of fresh-off-the-ice sea life in the cioppino at Phil's Fish Market at Moss Landing still lingers in the memory. But hey, I'm coming back 'cause it's close.

FOOD - 4 stars...plentiful cioppino, quite a variety of shellfish
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...didn't scream fish house to me
SERVICE - 3 stars...attentive at first but wavered as my meal went on and on
TOTAL - 4 stars...come here for the cioppino if you don't want to hang in North Beach
author: Ed U.

description:
1.50 Oyster Happy Hour! So yummy. Selection from all regions of North America 
Clam chowder was ON POINT!
Unpretentious and laid back.
author: Chris L.

description:
$2 Oysters on Saturdays/Sundays is what brought me here. Didn't disappoint and appreciated the variety of oysters.

We ordered the black mussels as well which was pretty good.

BUT, the bread I ordered to dip into the mussels sauce was amazing. I was kind of bummed bread didn't come free, but the crunch on the outside and soft on the inside, I was sold.
author: Lyrissa R.

description:
Came here on a Sunday anticipating a bustling hot spot full of people wanting oysters... and we were all alone.  It was around 12p and yes it's football season, so maybeeee people were at home?  But there were two big screen TVs showing the game, so I couldn't imagine a reason why people wouldn't be there.  Other than maybe the food wasn't good?  So I got incredibly nervous... but we stayed anyway.

$2 oysters for the selection available on the weekends, and $3 for the premium ones.  We tried them all.... Miyagis were amazing here as were the premium kumomotos.  Service was quick/attentive, but we were the only people there.  There is only beer/wine so no bloody mary's to accompany our dining experience (unless you want one made with sake, which the waiter kindly offered to us).  Also had the crabcake appetizers (didn't like so much) and a bowl of clam chowder.  Chowder was a little too thin for my liking because I prefer mine a bit more creamy.  The french fries were more like potato wedges which were seasoned well and tasty.

I'd give this place a 3.5 overall... wouldn't mind coming back here for more oysters!
author: Reena P.

description:
What Mission Street Oyster Bar has taught me: Do NOT eat oysters with heavy alcohol after!  

"Do not eat oysters accompanied by heavy alcohol - it causes them to pickle in your stomach - a fact which accounts for many mistaken cases of food poisoning."

This was what my bf and friend found out after eating 10 oysters and going to the bars afterwards.  I have a feeling it was the combination of oysters + alcohol, my bf thought we might've had a bad oyster, but I thought the oysters were good.  A lot of selection, felt fresh to me.  

It was $2 oysters all day on the weekends.  The calamari and fries were good too.  This place wasn't bad, just be careful if you drink after wards :)
author: Raquel Y.

description:
I've recently decided that I love oysters and came to dine here on a whim this last weekend. Between two people, we put down 36 oysters, and shared one of the specials of the day, a crab meat and avocado appetizer, which was incredible. 

We got a mix of the oysters, I can't remember all of them but my favorites were the Kumamoto Oysters & Miyagi Oysters. The service was great, we didn't have any issues during the visit and it was Happy Hour all weekend long, so oysters ranged between $2.00 - $3.00 each. 

For two beers each, the 36 oysters and the appetizer, our bill was about $135.00. A little pricey, but worth it.
author: Cat G.

description:
Clam chowder was excellent.  The green lip mussels were so tender that they ate like butter .
Everything was wonderful but they charge for bread.    Never been to a seafood restaurant that charges for bread.....Raise the price 1 dollar for everthing on the menu and give free all you can consume bread....
author: david h.

description:
Checked out this place on a whim when walking buy.

+ Super cheap oysters, different options that are tasty

That's it. Really, the wine list is boring, there's not much too the menu and the woman who served us and sat us had terrible service. But the price and options for oysters definitely overrode her terribleness.
author: Jonathan Q.

description:
Yes BUDDY!!!!  Another AWESOME Seafood spot in the greater Bay Area and I'm a fan!  I hot this spot up as I LOVE seafood and wasn't sure if I was going to enjoy the food, even after looking at other pics on Yelp.  Glad I took it upon myself to get my taste buds wet in a FLAVORABLE way :-))))  This spot is not that big, but big enough to get your stomach on FULL.

The prices were reasonable and food was DELLISH!!!  I enjoy the Garlic Crab-(very TASTY), Prawn Cocktail, Rockefeller Oysters-(Off the CHAIN) Loved em'...  I had a Crab Cocktail, some garlic bread and steamed veggies.  Everything was worth the drive and the servers were friendly.  The serve was good and I would definitely recommend this restaurant to others :-) 

Again, I spent close to $100, but all the food I got was worth it :-)
author: Pretty B.

description: Great food and good atmosphere. A little pricey but the quality of food is great. We ordered the shellfish variety, crab Caesar salad, some oysters, and clam chowder. Their crab salad was my favorite! Good portion for how much you pay for the meal.
author: Raisa M.

description: Great selection of oysters and impressed with the prices. Oysters were prepared quickly and correctly.  Service was decent.  Glad they were open.  Would definitely recommend coming back.
author: Stephanie W.

description:
Usually go during early afternoon. Shigoku oysters are the best! (The word shigoku means ultimate in Japanese, and the oysters truly are.)

Sandra and Freddy are awesome!
author: Roger G.

description: The oysters were good. The calamari was unimpressive. The dipping sauce was ketchup. The sole stuffed with crabmeat and bay shrimp was ok. The mashed potatoes were too salty to be edible without big bites of something else. The vegetables were perfect. The portions are generous. The servers and bus staff are friendly and attentive. I wouldn't drag anyone here, but a good meal overall.
author: Therese M.

description:
5 STARS ALL DAY! I have lived in SF since well before this place opened and I'm still appalled at how MSOB isn't popular yet. Where you at Anthony Bourdain?!?! Top tier quality seafood dishes here. Best cioppino outside of North Beach, and hands down the freshest Atlantic oysters in SF. If you want real briny oysters in combination with affordable price then look no further. My #1 spot for a romantic date that will leave me satisfied (even if I don't get laid).

Pros:
No wait for a table...EVER
Fresh seafood
Friendly Staff
Reasonably priced oysters
Chefs who know how to cook seafood
Fantastic house wines
Happy hour deals
Garlic bread

Cons:
Parking
author: Matt D.

description:
Who knew there's a National Oyster Day?!?

Yes, look it up. It exists.

Happy hour here seems to last forever. 12-6pm! And for $1.50 the oysters were fresh and totally worth it.

The clam chowder was as good as the ones I had in Boston, less the plane fare, so yes, this was a bargain.

I was also impressed that they had 4 varieties of oysters to choose from for Happy Hour!

Score!
author: Jack R.

description: Was there on Friday night. If you don't order the garlic bread an Cioppino, you just made the biggest mistake of your life. Our waitress steered us that direction and she was on point. Both were the best I've ever had. The Cioppino broth was incredible and it was loaded with seafood. The garlic bread insane. We ordered a mixed plate of 12 oysters and they were outstanding as well.
author: Mike B.

description: Very good food and great people!  I highly recommend the capellini!!
author: Joe M.

description: Thank you yelp for helping find a good fresh seafood restaurant,  definitely dine here again.
author: Debbie D.

description:
My boyfriend and I ordered oysters, plus a cioppino with extra garlic bread to share. The oysters were fresh and tasted great, but the real star was the cioppino. 

Before coming here, the cioppino from Woodhouse Fish Company was my favorite, but the dish here was such a great surprise! By far the biggest and most flavorful cioppino I've ever had, with a really generous portion of both broth and seafood that was plenty to share. Everyone raves about the garlic bread in the reviews, but I thought that dipping it in the broth is what made it so good, more than the bread itself. The cioppino is just that great.
author: Sara L.

description: This place seems to be an undiscovered gem.  The seafood is fresh and locally sourced.  Any dish with their large prawns is outstanding.  The chef knows what he is doing.  There was almost no one in the place the two times that I have been there.  Defiantly give this place a try.
author: Arthur W.

description: Everything here is tasty and fresh! Happy hour $2 dollar oysters and they were amazing. It's a family owned restaurant and the owners son is really nice and takes great care of you. Will definitely be back!
author: Karly C.

description: Wow, first time here but definitely not the last. Oysters were perfect and Cioppino was amazing! Loved it, highly recommend this place. Staff was great too
author: Susan V.

description: Great service, great atmosphere, amazing food. That was all I was going to say, but apparently I need to write more for this to qualify as a review. I was drunkenly walking down Mission st. when I stumbled upon this oyster bar. It was an overwhelmingly positive experience. I am traveling solo for work, so I was just looking for a place to sit and enjoy some food by myself. I'm a fan of oysters, so I thought why not, oyster bar sounds good. It was. I highly recommend coming here. Just do it. Amen.
author: Sam G.

description: Was all right for the cost. Good for those craving seafood. Didn't end up getting any oysters. $2 HH seems pricey to me but I may just be spoilt by NYC HH. Servings were a tad smaller than expected. Found crab cakes to be over fried; calamari was perfect.
author: Tiffany W.

description:
I've had this place bookmarked for awhile now and was waiting for a good excuse to try it out. That excuse finally came when the hubby and I were looking for a lunch spot on mission before he went to work. I was in the mood for seafood, so this seemed like a great option.
