Maybe take-out is the way to go?
author: Jordan P.

description: Great Oysters and awesome Coppino.  Prices are reasonable and service was great.  Don't let the lack of patrons deter you.  Delicious food!
author: Adam L.

description:
Can't beat $1 oysters (THREE TYPES) and 2.50 draughts! Best new seafood place in sf.

I WENT again, during happy hour which is short but from 5-6pm. But you can beat those $2.50 drafts including Lagunitas IPA, a Deschutes white IPA, and Speakeasy Prohibition ale!

They rotate through 3 kinds of oysters for happy hour (for only $1) not just one. We had the Miyagis, from Hog Island Oyster in Tomales Bay, Chesapeakes MD, and Fannie Mae (no not the one you owe money for your mortgage but a British Columbia oyster company you should hand your money to!). I also had the clam chowder which is reaaallly good. Not just that goopy stuff down near touristy pier 39, but a tasty flavorful broth that hasn't been simmering and sitting out all day. This left the soup delightfully light yet warm and seafood-y.

I was a fan of the Miyagis, but maybe that's me. Who cares when you can get 3 kinds of $1 oysters!

This place is burgeoning with future success. Right now, they don't even have enough tables to fill the whole space.....so go visit it before it turns into another Mission Chinese (which is only a few doors down!)
author: Nehal N.

description: Great oysters.  Great selection. Great service. Fresh. Refreshing.  Highly recommended !
author: Robert G.

description: A hidden gem that I don't want anyone else knowing about but they have to stay open I guess. Food is always consistent, but the cioppino with the slices of toasted goodness sprinkled with love & heroine will have you in seventh heaven! It's the best I've ever had! Location isn't the greatest but I'm glad for that! Which means, more for me!
author: Dallas S.

description: Wow.  Just wow.  So overpriced for what you get.  Ordered fish and chips for lunch and basically had six bites of fish and about 30 pre-packaged fries (you know, the ones that are pre-seasoned with that light batter).  Service was mediocre.  Don't worry, they won't make it given all of the food competition in SF, let alone the Mission.  What a huge disappointment.
author: Heather H.

description:
Yay! I'm actually happy that there is another $1 oyster place in the city. You'd think that we have enough but most are so busy and overcrowded that they're impossible to get in to. How many times have I tried to go to Hog Island's happy hour only to be discouraged by the neverending line???

I went on a Saturday afternoon. I strolled in right before the 3pm happy hour started. There were plenty of tables. The beer was cold, tasty and cheap. The service was very friendly. I also really liked my combination seafood cocktail. 

Yum! Yum!
author: Kiristen R.

description: I ate here over a year ago.  The waitress recommended the Cioppino.  It has become my benchmark!  Over the past year nothing has compared to the Cioppino at Mission Street Oyster Bar.  3 weeks ago I had the opportunity to return with a business associate and told him about the Cioppino.  I have another believer!  There is so much seafood in the Cioppino.  The broth is tasty but not overbearing.  I can't wait to go back again.
author: Bob S.

description: Delicious, fresh, solid seafood spot in the Mission, serving up San Francisco classics like Cioppino and Garlic Crab, as well as Chowder, Po'Boys, Shrimp Louie, and of course, raw oysters.  The salad dressings are homemade and fantastic.  Good selection of beer and wine.  Compared to other seafood restaurants in SF, this place is surprisingly affordable and a great value.  Can't wait to go back!!
author: Lauren M.

description:
This place opened recently and you can tell because it seems to be missing some decoration and they could fit a few more tables in the space they had. This place could benefit from a wine/beverage list as well.
We came by for happy hour which was pretty amazing- dollar oysters and $2.50 drafts.  They had 3 kinds of oysters to choose from that day- they rotate from day to day. Chesapeakes (Maryland), Miyagis (local), and Pacific Inlets (washington). The miyagis stood out in terms sweetness and flavor. The chesapeake had a buttery texture that reminded me of live scallop but was bland in flavor. We also ordered bread and chowder, which were both made very well.
We ate at the bar, and it seemed like the bartender was also the waitress for the sit-down tables. The service was quick and friendly- no complaints there.
Their menu is pretty extensive and I want to come back to try the cioppino and the soju oyster shooter.
author: Alfred L.

description: Restaurant was empty but the experience was high quality.  Service was attentive and friendly, perfect for a neighborhood casual meal.  The oysters were fresh and the variety fun.  We did a sampler at first; 12 oysters equally distributed.  We were quickly taken by a couple of the choices and opted for a second round.  The rest of the meal (chowder and the daily fish) was solid though unspectacular (found the fish bland though well prepared).  Pricing was reasonable as well.  Overall good experience and I'd return.
author: Jonathan L.

description: came here on a sunday for an early dinner.  we were greeting and seated right away.  server and bus person were nice and attentive.  all our dishes came out timely, temperature was hot and serving portions a good size.  we had the premium oysters $3/pc, clam chowder (ok, not the best i've had), the shrimp pasta (past was al dente and comes with 6 jumbo prawns) and the ciopinno (very large portion).  pricing is not cheap but on par with most other oyster bars in the city.  music was a bit too loud while eating.  we would have ordered dessert but the server gave us the bill, without asking whether we wanted any.  overall, the meal experience was okay....not spectacular and i'm not sure if i would choose to eat here again.
author: n y.

description: Had a date night with the boyfriend the other night. We absolutely love this place!! Everything was great!! I love seafood with a passion!!! We had quiet a bit of food to eat. We started with their $2.50 fresh Oysters!  Swear, we could of ate those all night! We also got the Oyster shooters, they were in a bloody mix! For a main I got a ceasar salad and the special fish dinner that night (totally blanking what fish) but it came with roasted potatoes and veggies. The l boyfriend got the  Seafood Cioppino which was awesome, i was a little bit jealous. LoL! Definately a new date spot!
author: Chelsey M.

description:
You wouldn't necessarily expect an Oyster Bar to be on Mission Street. But there it is, right on Mission and 19th next to a taqueria. I really enjoyed this place. I went twice: once for lunch and again for happy hour. I went to happy hour with two friends and we got a little carried away with the $1 oysters! Be careful, because ordering a soup, several oysters, a drink, and maybe one other item can easily rack up your bill.

The oyster selection is outstanding and very fresh. They offer a wide variety of oysters. The servers are knowledgeable about each kind of oyster. Each oyster has a very distinct taste and look. 

The clam chowder was great and creamy. The crab sandwhich was AMAZING! 

I highly recommend the Mission Street Oyster Bar.
author: Barbara W.

description: There was traffic on the 101 so we decided to hop off and grab oysters in the mission instead of some of our other favorite spots. The HH seemed like a good idea as it was early in the afternoon on a weekday. Now, we know a bad oyster can happen anywhere, unfortunately it happened to us here. We had four different types and only one of our party of two got sick so it must have only been one bad one. On the upside, the clam chowder was good! As was the beer!
author: kristen c.

description:
This place is awesome!  The seafood is super high quality and wonderfully fresh.  I love Anchor Oyster Bar in the Castro, but there's always a massive wait.  I'd read that the chef at Mission Street Oyster worked at Anchor for years, so I decided to check it out.

My party of three arrived at 7pm on a Sunday, and there was no wait.  We started with oysters, which are $2 per oyster all weekend long!  The selection included six varied oysters, including Kumamotos, my personal favorite.  The oysters were expertly shucked - no shell or mangling at all - which is sadly pretty rare, even among places that profess to be oyster specialists. 

We ordered the frutti di mare - clams, mussels, green mussels, fish, prawns, and crab in a white wine garlic sauce.  Each piece of seafood was amazingly fresh, tender, and well-flavored.  The dish was packed with seafood goodness, and our table of three probably could have shared it and gone home happy.  Instead, we also ordered the pasta with prawns in a white wine, tomato, and basil sauce and the cod special.  The cod was flaky and tender with excellent flavor and a nice breading, which was crispy without being crunchy.  The pasta was quite delicious and came with five or six big prawns. 

The ambiance is a little lacking - the restaurant has a cavernous, sterile feel, but you'll be so impressed by the food, you probably won't notice.
author: Pearl L.

description:
The quality of the filet of sole the other day late afternoon was great and the service couldn't be beat, but ONE MAJOR DEFECT was that it cooled rapidly.  It was NOT served on a hot plate. 
    Haven't seen anything like SF's Zims Restaruaunts in years where food was served and kept piping hot on a silver hot plate, but the regular plate Mission Street Oyster Bar used the other day was cold.
author: David S.

description:
FOOD: meh.

The cioppino is a few bucks more than Tadich Grill but the portions are larger.

Broth was salty and slightly watery and seemed to be lacking any spices.

The fish and other seafood were cooked to perfection.

The garlic bread is delicious. I will go back just for the bread.

SERVICE: lacking.

I was was one three customers at the time. The waiter filled the water for the other customers twice but bypased me both time even though he had to walk past me every time.

ATMOSPHERE:
bar type with music.

------------------------------------------

I may come back for the oysters and garlic bread, but when it comes to cioppino, I will go to Tadich Grill.
author: Evan W.

description: My husband and I had dinner her on Saturday, we had the oysters, crab avocado salad and the prawns pasta and it was EXCEPTIONAL!!! In fact it was sooooo good we had to go back on Sunday for lunch!!! Amazing.
author: Andrea A.

description: I actually re-activated my Yelp account just to give this place a good review! The oysters were great and the waiter recommended a variety of them, We appreciated that! Usually at seafood restaurants they are a bit stingy with the portion of food, but here they give you a great amount for your money. I was impressed ! Everything tasted amazing and you can't order without the garlic bread, it is delicious! It's safe to say I will be a returning customer. Great food, welcoming service, you can't beat it!
author: Angelica V.

description: Craving oysters and wine, a friend recommended here.  Really nice, and reasonably priced, mix of oysters available.  We shared the crab made in awesome garlic, lemon, wine broth. Also reasonable in price and clearly fresh.  Super great service.  It's a gem in a quiet block (at night) in the Mission.
author: Nicole O.

description: I came in for lunch, and got half a dozen of oysters. For a place that is called an oyster bar, they had a pretty incompetent shucker the day I went because my oysters were full of broken shell that I had to repeatedly spit out. One of the oysters had a worm in it as well. I looked up oyster worms online, and I learned that they live naturally on oyster shells and only fall into the inside of a shell if a place doesn't clean their oysters well enough.
author: Michelle H.

description:
Was on Mission and most places weren't open yet. 4:30pm. Happy Hour Speakeasy and $1.50 oysters called me in.  The Rockpoint and Effingham oysters were great. If you like Miyagi, you will like these. 

Will be back to try more off the menu. I am a sucker for clam chowder. They do Boston style here.
author: INTHECITY S.

description: The place has "oyster" right in its name. I don't really like oysters, but that's OK--they've got pastas, soups, salads, and plenty of other dishes. I had the clam chowder and the pasta with prawns, both of which were quite good and very filling. Our waitress was very nice and seemed quite knowledge about types of oysters. And the place was able to accommodate a large group just fine. All in all, I would come back again. Maybe I'll try an oyster or two too.
author: Daylen Y.

description: What an awesome find! Mission Special all the way - delicious oysters and the butter sauce that comes with the clams and prawns is outrageous. The gazpacho was super fresh, spicy, and delicious. Great beers and reasonable wine. Very nice friendly service. I debated writing this because I don't want them to be discovered ;) but they deserve it!
author: Lis W.

description: The menu style and the food are quite similar to Anchor Oyster Bar but more affordable. And there is no horrible line as we often see in front the Anchor Oyster Bar. On the weekends, the ordinary oysters are $2.0/pierce while the premium ones remain $2.5/pierce. During the happy hour, the ordinary ones are only $1.5/pierce. We ordered the cioppino and it was very tasty. The size is perfect for two people. I strongly recommend that dish. The waitress was nice, too.
author: Hua W.

description: I never write reviews but This time I had to! This place is awesome!! The garlic crab is ridiculous, seriously to die for. The fried sampler is also delicious. The service is great and so is the ambiance. Overall an awesome experience!
author: Anna K.

description: I came to the city with one fantasy in mind, spend the evening drinking bubbly and eating oysters. This place helped make that fantasy come true. Small and clean, the service was great and they had 8 different kinds of oysters to decide on. I started with one of each, then picked out three that were my favorites and had 2 more of each of them. Others in my party had the mission sampler, crab salad, among other things. Everyone was happy, our server was attentive and helpful, and we had a great time. My only suggestion, expand the wine list.
author: Christiana G.

description: I was pumped to visit this place because, well, I love oysters and it had good reviews.  It was a Thursday night at primetime and we arrived... crickets. Literally, the entire place was empty. Not a single other person in the entire establishment.  And, it smelled like fish. Not fresh fish, or cooking fish. Like fishy fish. We were temped to turn around immediately, but decided to give it a shot. We ordered an oyster sampler and it was perfectly good, but nothing to write home about. There was nothing unique or particularly stand out, and nothing especially tasty that made me happy we stayed. Don't get me wrong, they were fine. But overall, extremely mediocre experience.
author: Katherine D.

description:
This place served us spoiled crab and lied about it.

My boyfriend and I were excited to try this seafood place.  We ordered the oysters, clams, and crab.  The oysters and clams were good, but the crab had an extremely strong ammonia smell to it.  It actually burned when I was eating it, so I called over the waitress to let her know.  She checked with kitchen staff and told me that they said it was perfectly okay and that it was just the brine they use.  I felt bad asking but I just wanted to make sure it was safe, and she assured me it was.  When we got home, we looked up ammonia smell and crab, and several sources stated that this means crab is spoiled and a serious health risk (as it may contaminate other food that is being served).  I'm really disappointed.  They not only didn't apologize or take corrective action, but instead lied about it and continued to serve us and other customers this food.  We're hoping we don't get food poisoning now.
author: Marissa H.

description:
$1 oysters 3-6 mon-thurs.

pretty empty on a wednesday night around 5:30, guess that's good for us! 

got the miyagi and rock..something oysters. yummy.

the place smelled like bleach and little fruit flies were zooming in and out...

the vibe was just weird at this time...

but yay for the oysters
author: Christine M.

description: Very good food. I would not say that about service. First of all i was not informed of all the different selections of oysters. When asked for recommendations... My answer was all are good. Strangely, when another party of caucasian females came in; they were informed. We later wanted to try shellfish combo and was brought steamed calms. When asked. Server replied. I didn't hear you. I thought you wanted steam calms. Whatever. I also observed server snacking on food... Idk, but not very professional. Bill comes 90.00. Eh. Will I come back. Hell nah. Decor is 1 star.
author: Monika T.

description:
Restauranteurs, don't you know that this constant need to upsell cries out "desperation" on your part and is a huge turn-off for customers??  

We came here yesterday for an early dinner and was immediately greeted by the server who waited on us the 1st time we were there.  She remembered us and was very friendly.  So we were really looking forward to another great dining experience with them.  However, when we started ordering, I said I wanted the fried calamari appetizer (along with the dozen oysters we're sharing, the pasta dish my partner ordered and our drinks) and the waitress started suggesting the seafood fry.  I said I'll be happy with what we've ordered.  The waitress finally left, but not before insisting on leaving a menu on our rather small table.  The oysters and the pasta dishes remained as delicious as we've had them from the first time.  The calamari, however, was of the kind you might find from a roadside cafe, when you made the mistake of ordering a very unpopular dish and it's the last portion they have from deep inside their freezer.  At $14, I definitely felt ridiculous having to pay for this tiny portion of paper thin calamari that I ended up leaving more than half behind.

When our bill came, it was over $70 including tax.  How much is enough for you to stop upselling us?
author: Yvette F.

description: Hands down, one of the BEST seafood dinners I've ever had. Boyfriend and I dropped in for oyster appetizers on Valentine's day before our reservation at a different restaurant...so we grabbed a seat at the bar and everyone's plates looks so amazing we ended up staying and not regretting it. We both had different specials for the night, mine was a lobster/seafood plate and his was a seafood gumbo sort with savory cheese bread. The oysters were very fresh and perfectly chilled.
author: Kalong W.

description: Maybe the best oysters I've ever had! I felt like the ocean was in my mouth! The decor needs some work.
author: Diana K.

description: This is a gem in a neighborhood filled with coal.  Excellent seafood and fresh oysters to boot.  The clam chowder was filled with hand cut clams and was the perfect consistency.  I ordered the stuffed sole and the chef hit it out of the park.  I wish I lived close to this place so I could dine there more often, sigh.
author: David S.

description: On a recent trip and my first vist to San Francisco, I enjoyed happy hour oysters and a wonderful crab dinner at the Mission Street Oyster Bar while staying in the neighborhood. Manager Tim and his staff were gracious and engaging. The oysters were fresh and affordable, and the pan-roasted dungeness was yummy, if not a bit more work to eat than I had anticipated. The garlic cheese bread is crazy good by itself and indispensable to soaking up the white wine garlic sauce. I will come back when I return, and would recommend them to you, dear reader, without reservation.
author: John S.

description:
Came here with my boyfriend and his buddy during happy hour on a Wednesday afternoon. We were surprised to find such a great oyster bar in the middle of the Mission. During happy hour, oysters were $1.50 each, and we ended up ordering 30 oysters. I'm not too familiar with different types of oysters, but we just got a mix of whatever they offered for happy hour. They were all sooo delicious!  I also ordered a bowl of clam chowder, which was creamy and full of delicious goodness. 
Their was a waiter and a waitress working, and both were very attentive to our table. They were both super friendly too.
author: Lin M.

description: This place is a secret gem. You wouldn't think it is as nice as it based on the exterior, but I guess that's the charm of San Francisco especially in the Mission. When you walk it it's so chic and has a seaside charm. Hands down great food. The cioppino is a must order and the selection of oysters is great.
author: Maeling D.

description: Went for $1 Oyster Happy Hour...and left satisfied. The oysters were yummy and fresh. The one questionable aspect of this place is that it was completely empty for the first 45 minutes we were there (during happy hour?)...so that was odd, but other than that it was great!
author: Julianne S.

description: Tried the Pasta Alfredo. Disgusting!!! Made me puke.  The smell the flavor was just horrible! Not worth your $$
author: Giselle P.

description: Fabulous oyster happy hour.  Cheap, super freshly-shucked oysters with ample briny water in the oyster cup, always a good sign of freshness.   Nice mignonette to accompany.  Limited to a dozen per person, but no worries for an afternoon meal.  Chowder was good, not mind-blowing, but generous and tasty.  Good beer selection and lastly, very friendly wait staff on my visit during a quiet late afternoon.  Will return when back in the Bay Area.  Love the neighborhood, too.
author: Terry W.

description: A wonderful find in the Mission District tucked between little souvenir shops and close to a parking lot. The two of us dined during the day on 14 raw oysters on the half shell (fresh and delicious from various places), hearty clam chowder, one of the specials of the day Seared Tuna sliders and our main course of perfectly steamed crab. We will be back here next time in the city.
author: David S.

description: Found this on yelp as the best fried oysters in San Francisco. Went on a Sunday night- we were the only people in the place. The fried oysters were small, with a very dark batter that tasted burned. The tartar sauce was good. Had battered scallops for dinner- scallops were nice. The vegetables that came with it were impossible to cut with the knife provided- basically raw. So many wonderful restaurants in San Francisco- please don't waste your time here!
author: Mary A.

description: Fresh oysters, great draft beer--and the world's best cioppino, big enough for two people. It doesn't get better than this. The mystery is why the place is nearly empty during the week, when there should be lines out the door.
author: David K.

description: The food was okay but probably overpriced. The oysters were fresh. Can't beat $1.5 each on weekdays and $2 on weekends and holidays. The fanny bay oysters were our favorites.
author: Carson J.

description: Well....happy hour $1 oysters, 3p-6p. Awesome. Tall, shorter hair, tomboyish girl server was very kind and friendly. I will be back.
author: Jorge T.

description: Get the whole garlic crab and go during happy hour for cheap fresh oysters. This place is an undiscovered gem - forget the lines at Swan - go here!
author: Joel B.

description:
not sure why this place isn't more popular, the food was great!!! actually, one of the best parts about this place is that there's no wait....which makes you wonder... but then the food is actually really good, so it's a win-win!

pasta w/ shrimp - they give you an option of sauce choices, i got the garlic sauce and it was awesome! my friend got the same pasta with spicy marinara sauce and they actually looked very similar and tasted kind of similar so regardless of the sauce choice, it's still great! :)

cioppinio - it's actually a pretty portion; we got it to share for 4 people and couldn't finish it since we each had our own entrees as well. the soup is pretty thick and very rich, good amount of seafood and you get garlic bread with it. 

garlic bread - super yummy! 

the only draw back is that they seem to be very lean on their staffing so it takes a while to get your food. Also, the waitress couldn't distinguish between the different pastas we ordered when it came out so we had to switch dishes a few times to get it right. None of us had touched it yet though so it was fine :)
author: Elyse R.

description: So totally non-pretentious, it has the airs of a sit down taco joint, which is kind of a sigh of relief in new Mission restaurants these days. But the food was fabulous. I highly recommend the Seafood Gazpacho: deeply filled with crab and deliciousness. The house wine is fine, but i might suggest diversifying the wine selection overall, to match the special food.
author: Rachel S.

description: Crazy how few people know about this lovely secret, great oyster bar, great service - plain ambiance but that seems to keep the casual visitors out, love this place.
author: Matthew B.

description: Loved it...period. Very fresh seafood and the best oysters in the city period. A d our server Maria was charming and very helpful. We had never been so we mixed it up a bit. I got the Sol stuffed with crab and prawns. It was light for a stuffed dish and the flavors were so balanced that I could distinguish each ingredient. We also had the mission fry that had fried oysters, calamari and prawns served with fries all fried perfectly. And the best for last, the few oysters. They had a nice selection so we just picked a few to try at the happy hour price that I think 2.00 each. It came with your simple red cocktail sauce and horseradish but, there was a small light vinigar/wine drizzle which ended up being the only thing we used. The oysters were so perfect they didn't need the sauce or even the lemon.
author: Carl C.

description: Love this place. Freshest oysters around. Always different types to choose from. Wonderful service from all their staff. Will definitely come back!
author: Anna L.

description: Service was good. Food was impeccable. The seafood here is on point. Had some Kunamoto oysters as an appetizer for $2 per oyster. Delicious and very reasonably priced. Ordered the dinner special of the red Idaho trout with garlic sauce which was $20. It was served with steamed carrots, broccoli, cauliflower and some baked potatoes. The trout was so tender and juicy and the skin was crispy. The sides were so healthy tasting. Had 2 pints of the 312 Urban Wheat ale. It's brewed in Chicago and has a light taste to it with a dryer aftertaste. I really liked the beer and it was just $4 per pint.
author: Thien-Tu T.

description: Extremely fresh sea food.  Extremely well prepared.  Likewise prices may seem high but it's reasonable for the quality of food.  I just wish the service was a little better.  Fill my water and ask if we need anything else.  Otherwise 5 stars!
author: Peter B.

description: Great fresh seafood options! Crab cakes, fried oysters, lightly breaded scallops & prawns and the ciopino!
author: Craig S.

description: Super spot, great prices, and my dinner guests RAVED about the oysters. Highly recommended and nice easy-going staff
author: Ian S.

description:
I have now been here many times since the last review, and while I'm an oyster devotee, I've tried other things on the menu. If I good 6 stars I would, the food is that good! Very flavorful , large portions, and always fresh. I have only had excellent meals here.

Cioppino - Amazing! Chock full of fresh seafood, fresh herbs, and the most delish cioppino broth I've ever had. Easily an entree for two.

Fish & Chips - Fantastic, and I'm not a fish & chips lover. Perfectly crispy batter, not greasy at all, fresh fish and awesome  fries.

Oysters & steamed clams & prawns special - Got this on the recommendation of our server and I'm so glad we did. Besides your dozen fresh oysters, you get a sizeable bowl of steamed clams and 4 large prawns in a wonderful savory broth, perfect for dipping your scrumptious GARLIC BREAD! Another excellent entree to share!
author: Lisa M.

description: This place is amazing! I recommend this place to any seafood lover (especially shrimp and oysters lovers) They really know how to prepare shrimp. For an appetizer my girlfriend and I got the fried calamari and it was really fresh. For dinner we had the spicy marinara with prawns... DELICIOUS! Highly recommend the spicy marinara pasta with prawns. The pasta is cooked perfectly and the prawns were succulent.
author: Emilio M.

description:
this is more a 3 1/3 stars place.  food was solid.  I had the chowder for a starter and prawns on a skewer for dinner.  The chowder was good, not too thick.  The prawns were tasty and the FF with it were great.  My GF had the crab cakes and seafood salad.  the cc were good but the sauce for it was a bit too high on the mayo and lacked taste.  fortunately the crab cakes were good by themselves.  the salad was large and full of taste though the dressing did not match up on the taste side.

The atmosphere left a little to be desired.  the lay out is cold and rather not that inviting, especially in relation to the quality of food.  it looks like a run of the mill restaurant but the quality of food is at a higher level that it desires a bit more style or atmosphere.  So that is why 3 1/2 stars.  you will like it and probably return.  if the feels was a bit better, you would absolutely return.  oh, and not let the fact that it is in the mission throw you off.  Parking was actually easy to find.

the serivces was good but not great.  if it were busier, this could be an issue.

price was fine for what we recieved.
author: Tim F.

description:
Food was ok, nothing spectacular. The service was unhelpful, and seemed confused. 

Ordered the Cioppino based on reading other reviews and I was not impressed, actually regretted it.

Ambiance could have been better, the smell was a little off putting.

Considering there are so many excellent seafood places in the area, I don't think I will go back.
author: Lindsey T.

description: Blah - Oysters were pretty uninspired and were not cheap ($2.50/each) since it wasn't happy hour.    Place had a weird smell to it, other seafood was overcooked.   It was okay, but I'll not be headed back anytime soon.
author: Susan C.

description: I'm so happy to have a fresh seafood and oyster bar close to my house!  The daily specials keep me coming back for filling healthy dinners and the cracked crab varieties are awesome this winter.  If you are more of a shooter  happy hour fan, the oysters and cup of chowder hits the spot.  $1 oysters and $2.50 draft beers - can't beat that!
author: Aileen B.

description: Amazing food. Steve is great. We had the oysters and the fried calamari and the crab meat cocktail, and it was delicious. They also gave us oyster crackers and garlic bread. Win.
author: Manuel A.

description:
We went on a Friday night, it was just two of us and we made up maybe 25% of the people at the restaurant. Who would have thought it would be so empty on a Friday night. Guess this isn't the place to go on Fridays. Hopefully it is more packed earlier in the week.

The food was good, nothing spectacular, but the price was also satisfactory. Did not break the bank to eat and have a bottle of wine. I would come back here, the staff was friendly, mabye because they didnt have to worry about too many other people.
author: Sebastien D.

description: The most amazing seafood dish I have ever experienced: The Cioppino.  Dont even think about it.  Soooooo good!  I will remember this dish until I am back in this foodie city.  Loved it!!!!!!
author: Bruce K.

description: It was raining outside, and some soup sounded good.   Mission Street Oyster Bar just opened today, so I gave it a try at about 9 pm.   Seemed to be more waiters, cooks, and owners, then guests.   I sampled the soup.   Clam Chowder.   It was good.   Left me with a good feeling.  I didn't much like the music on the radio.   the  walls could use some art, and the lights some softening touches.
author: Gregory D.

description:
This review is for the OYSTERS ONLY.

Me and my girlfriend went here on happy hour for oysters, which were only $1 each! But the limit is only a dozen for 1 person. Poop.

Anyways, the oysters were good and you don't have to go all the way to Hog Island Oyster Bar.
author: Joey H.

description: Great value, big servings, and friendly service. I recommend this spot for happy hour every day of the week. Yummy and fresh oysters and crab.
author: Matthew B.

description: quality has gone down hill on our last 2 visits. oysters are still good but the fishermens stew, what we would come here for, is bland and lacking in the abundance of ingredients that it used to have.
author: Brian T.

description: Fresh and delicious, amazing Gazpacho  and oysters Yummy !! Cant wait to go back.
author: Mona L.

description: This place is a great addition to the neighborhood.  Oysters were fresh and delicious, and the chowder was really good to.  Will definitely be back for some oysters and cocktails soon!
author: Craig L.

description: Everything was delicious and the service was fantastic. The waitstaff was very friendly and made excellent suggestions. Two dollar oysters on the weekend and all fresh and tastey. Ill definitely be coming back!
author: thomas i.

description: Went there for lunch today and thought it was AMAZING. The clam chowder was very tasty. If it's on the menu that day, I highly recommend the oyster poboy! SOOOOO good! The staff was very friendly and loved the atmosphere inside. Will DEFINITELY go back!!
author: Lupe G.

description: We went friday night to celebrate our anniversary.  They did not disappoint.  The food was GREAT!  The oysters were to die for and I had the Crab roasted in garlic was fantastic as well as the cioppino.  We also had the seafood salad with Louie dressing and it was really good as well.  The staff especially Fred was really nice and helpful.  This place is small and the area is not the best, but once you walk through the doors you are embraced by a very comfortable atmosphere.
author: Suzy B.

description:
I'd return for happy hour. Great deals on fresh yummy oysters.
The other entrees and apps that we ordered weren't that great for the price--mahi mahi, clam chowder, mussels. Total was $60/person. Ambiance leaves some to be desired for a restaurant trying to cater to more upscale clientele since it's fairly casual. I think if they reduced their prices a bit and went for a more mid-level crowd, it'd be just fine.
author: J L.

description: Our group had four great dinners last night. Normally I don't go for fried appetizers, but for some reason we got the mixed seafood fry, and it was the lightest and freshest fried calimari, oysters and shrimp I've ever had. The fettuccine with prawns in a red sauce was excellent. The two fish fillets my dinner companions had were excellent and I took a dip into the cioppino, which was wonderful. This place rocks. You can find it by the blue awning.
author: Michael R.

description: Went last night with some friends who had already visited. The food was excellent -- we had oysters (a large variety), steamed mussels (delicious!), seafood gazpacho (I may go back specifically for that on a warm day) and an assortment of other dishes, all really fresh and yummy. The service was friendly and timed well. Overall, a wonderful place -- we'll definitely be back.
author: Joaquin S.

description:
I am so happy a high quality fresh, fresh seafood restaurant has opened in the Mission.
Starting with the most delicious garlic bread I've had, way better than any Italian restaurant I've been to, just yummy!
The Shrimp Scampi were divine as were the Scallops, (first time I've had Scallops that weren't overcooked and tough), tender and delish!
All my friends just loved what they had as well and we all told the lovely server and the really friendly chef who came out to meet us that we'd be back again and again.
Can't wait to try everything on the menu and the specials,
We went for a Sunday brunch but ate from the dinner menu.
Way good and good prices too!
author: Richelle D.

description:
I've been into this restaurant twice and thoroughly, THOROUGHLY enjoyed myself BOTH times. It was so good the first time that I had to go back again before we left SF. Their oysters were super fresh and absolutely delicious. I'd say, being a big fan of oysters, this was just like the more popular joints like Hog Island or Anchor Oyster Bar which was so refreshing that we didnt have to wait long for our food. 

We ordered the crab with cocktail sauce for appetizer as well. This was very good, a nice change from a traditional shrimp cocktail. The crab meat was sweet and fresh. We really liked this a lot. 

For our main course we ordered the seafood stew called the Frutti di Mare. This was AWESOME!! BY FAR, one of the best seafood stews I've ever had. That plus their garlic bread was a winning combination. Think vongole, minus the pasta, plus a whole lot of flavors and seafood. This isn't your plain butter/ white wine sauce....it was loaded with other ingredients that gave the dish a lot more complex flavors and added deliciousness. I really love it and would go back for more in a heartbeat. 

You can't leave without having the Bomba for dessert as well. Its a mix of two sorbets (I believe a passionfruit and raspberry??) in a white chocolate shell. It truly is the BOMB! Had it both times :-)

Service was also really good. Our server Mel was very friendly and helpful and never screwed up. I'm not sure why people would complain about the service. This place isn't claiming to be a five star joint, relax about your expectations. Still, I think over all the service was perfect, I had no complaints for both occassions and there were a few other tables besides us as well. 

I will definitely be back the next time i'm in the city!
author: Bianca E.

description:
This is such a wonderful addition, improvement on Mission St. 
The chef/owner Fredy Gamez had been chef for 18 years at Anchor Seafood in the Castro so he definitely knows his stuff.  
1 dozen oysters $2.95/each; the platter consisted 3 each very fresh, plump kinds of oysters.  
Fried oysters $10.95 were very tasty; yet skimpy as there was only 9 oysters on the plate. This could be filled in with a coleslaw or some greens.
Seafood gazpacho $16.95 was excellent; it consisted of large chunks of crab along with prawns, white fish, calamari, & bay shrimps topped with very fresh avocado slices, sour cream, & celery stalk.  
We also had the pasta special which consisted of linquine topped with prawms & sausage in a very delicious marinara sauce.  
The wine list needs improvements, but what we had was good.
Service was very good, friendly. The waitress was accomodating, made very nice suggestions, as well as explained what we had ordered.  
There is no dessert at this point.  
The space is good with shades of blue on the wall, large bar, lots of good-sized tables.  It still is pretty new so once there is artwork up, & the large empty front space filled in maybe with a host table & some trees, it will look much more organized & well-established.
The only drawback is the location - Mission between 18th & 19th - which is a very sketchy block to say the least.
We will go again, mostly likely at Happy Hour when there is $1 oysters.
author: Pam R.

description: This place is alright but for the price, you really aren't getting a good deal. My partner got the fried oysters and there were only about 6-7 pieces for $13. We also ordered the steamed black mussles and for $19.99 the mussels were tiny (though there were many) and salad, bread, and even fries did not come with it! So expensive!  The wait staff never asked us how we were doing either. The 2 dollar symbol needs to be changed to 3 if you ask me...
author: A P.

description:
As fate may have it, I had a lovely birthday dinner here. After an internet search we came upon a restaurant that I had heard about just a week prior. Not in the most desirable location, i must admit, but one must look past that. This place has some really tasty dishes on the menu and the seafood is fresh. 
Our table ordered a special appetizer and five entrees which we all shared. I believe the standouts were the Cioppino and the Fruttii de Mare. Both with luscious sauces, one the traditional red and the other a white wine and garlic, fresh shellfish, which included a pile of the most flavorful crab meat. They really were treats for the taste buds. Yes these were the two standout dishes but don't get me wrong every thing was tasty, well seasoned and unique in flavor. 
The decor had little to be desired, but the waitstaff was ok, and the prices were very reasonable. I would generally sit down for my seafood meal at Anchor in the Castro, but why would i wait in line and pay more?  Thanks MSOB for a nice night!
author: Anthony A.

description: $1.50 oysters happy hour 3-6pm mon-fri. garlic bread $5.50. $4 Trumer pils just perfect for days
author: Joyce S.

description: As a tourist it's out of the way, but worth the trip. A great selection of various oysters and other seafood on the menu as well. The service is great and very friendly. The restaurant is VERY clean as well. Our favorite oyster bar in the Bay Area. Definitely coming here every time we are in town.
author: Matt B.

description: Mission Street Oyster Bar is a hidden gem in SF. Great clams, mussels, fried shrimp, Caesar salad and the best garlic bread in the world. It was not packed tonight....but I can't figure out why. Maybe the word is not out, or everyone is taking a break from dining out. Great service, good location, easy parking. This place is not to be missed. Can't wait to try some other tasty dishes.
author: Jane P.

description: This is a great find!  We had dinner there last night.  The service was outstanding and the food was fantastic!  The Cioppino was delicous.  We highly recommend this restaurant.  We will be back!
author: Janet B.

description: not so much going on for happy hour. i think it was $1.50 oysters.  i don't recall drink specials
author: Anna S.

description:
Walked in last Sunday at around 5:00 pm got great $1 oysters and my fav Lagunitas IPA.  

Really like the place and the oysters.  Another great day in the Mission.
author: maria g.

description: This spacious new seafood restaurant is a welcome addition to the neighborhood. We walked in on a Saturday at 5:30 to take advantage of the $1 happy hour oysters and had no problem getting seated. The 3 choices of oysters were all fresh and served traditional style with fresh lemon, cocktail sauce with horseradish and a Mignonette sauce. The crab cakes, fish and chips and steamed shellfish were all generous portions and delicious. The chef/owner Freddy Gamez having cooked at Anchor Oyster Bar in the Castro knows his stuff.
author: George M.

description: Great place for reasonably priced seafood. Clams and mussels in their broth are fantastic, especially with their signature side of garlic bread. This place should be packed with customers but it's not. Definitely under the radar but probably won't be as more diners discover this place.
author: Frank Z.

description:
Have been to this new place half a dozen times and each experience was full of great food. 

Had some delicious fried scallops two weekends ago with the BF, who ordered a prawns-and-pasta dish that was divine. We were impressed with the portions of the seafood and the sides, and the prices were moderate.

The staff were friendly and attentive, and food was brought to our table piping hot. 

I've returned to the Mission Street Oyster Bar once a week now and look forward to another hearty and tasty meal this weekend.
author: Michael P.

description: This is a great little hidden gem on Mission street. Don't pass it up for the Valencia Corridor, just because Mission Street hasn't had a gentrified makeover. The staff was very nice and the food was great! Seafood is never "cheap," but their prices are better than other seafood restaurants. If you want a traditional oyster bar with traditional straight-forward type options in the Mission District area then come here. They had a variety of oytsters from WA VA, BC, Tomales Bay and more! They also have $1 Happy Hour oysters too, which currently runs 12-6pm!  I didn't have the ciopinno, but my friend has had it and it comes highly recommended.
author: Christy N.

description: I was pleasantly surprised. Good, fresh oysters and a healthy serving of seafood. Give it shot.
author: Ben E.

description:
My boyfriend and I were wandering around the Mission on search of food (a difficult task, I know), when we happened upon a guy standing outside a brand new and deserted oyster bar offering us a free oyster each if we came in! I'm not one to refuse free oysters, so we decided to give it a try, and we were glad we did! We had:

Oysters (free): Big and fresh, bf was hoping they would be served live but he was happy enough with recently deceased.
Clam chowder: Delicious, not too full of potatoes, although I think  it could be improved by the addition of bacon! 
Oyster crackers: My clam chowder came with oyster crackers! I looked down the bar and there was a huge bowl overflowing with packets of oyster crackers. I have never had my clam chowder served with oyster crackers since I moved to SF! Maybe I've been going to the wrong places? After listening to me flipping my lid with excitement for a few minutes, the amused bartender brought me extra oyster crackers. I stuffed them in my bag and took them home. Awww yeah!
Calamari: I'm not sure what they put in this stuff, I'm guessing crack? It had a flavor that was spicy without being hot. I couldn't stop eating it! I'm afraid this place has ruined every other restaurant's calamari for me.
Crab cocktail: My dear bf hogged this but I managed to sneak a taste, and it was super fresh and delicious.
Garlic bread (also free): I was all set to ignore the plate full of free garlic bread, because I don't like garlic, but I ended up eating a ton of it. It was very cheesy, more like a white pizza with garlic I guess?

Insert typical disclaimer that I don't write yelp reviews except for that one place which blah blah blah. I have to face the fact that I write yelp reviews now and I am a true SF foodie. I feel like I don't even know myself anymore... Sigh.

tl;dr: freshalicious, also oyster crackers
author: Skyler L.

description: Fantastic food. Pretty similar menu (if not the same) as Anchor Oyster Bar (my original go-to in SF), and same great taste. But this place is much roomier and takes reservations, which definitely gives it a leg up. Get the steamed clams and dip your bread in the broth all night long. Everything was delicious!
author: Heidi K.

description: Mission Street Oyster bar is my favorite seafood restaurant in the bay area. In a city like San Francisco with unlimited dining options and incredible competition, this restaurant never fails to deliver a unforgettable meal. The service is unpretentious and friendly and the seafood is incomparably fresh. Located in the Mission, a neighborhood which has recently experienced an explosion of new restaurants, mission street oyster bar is a stand out. It is on a block of taquerias, markets and small apparel shops, and many pass it over because it is not on the trendy Valencia corridor. They don't know what they are missing!!! 2$ oysters, the best crab and shrimp louis, crab cakes to die for, and hands down the best steamed shellfish combination ever! Their daily specials include seared ahi, petrale sole stuffed with crab, seared scallops, corvina, etc. Their house wines are very reasonable priced and they have a good beer selection as well. Try this place one time and you will become a regular.
author: Julia A.

description: I have dreams about this place. Yes, the food is that good ladies and gentleman! You will not be disappointed.
author: J. R.

description: Came in with a friend at around 5pm for some happy hour oysters and chowder.  Unfortunately the place was empty. We got some free garlic bread which was incredible and had a few of the well selected draft beers ($2.50 at happy hour!). The oysters we had were very good and so was the chowder.
author: Zach F.

description: The pride that this place takes in its ingredients and service is evident in every bite. Incredible oyster selection and the Cali crab burger was both light as air and delicious. We'll def be back!
author: Al K.

description: Definitely the best oyster bar/seafood restaurant in the area.  Much better than Woodhouse Fish Company.  All the seafood were fresh and delicious.  Garlic Bread was super tasty.  Ordered the Frutti Di mare, lots of seafood.  The prawns with pasta was great, pasta was al dente and dish overall was very flavorful. Definitely go back again soon!
author: Ben S.

description: Good food, overall. I've been here several times already. The first time was great, the second time was ok. They have a good selection of oysters. The clam chowder is good, garlic bread is good...overall happy with this place.
author: Miss P.

description: Stopped in with some friends and had a feast. Service was very good and the food awesome. One of the best restaurant experience I ever had.
author: Kelby C.

description: Wow. I kind of hate to write this review because I know that soon, there will  be lines out the door. We had oysters on the happy hour special. Every bit as good as Zuni at a fraction of the cost. The crab cakes were genuinely the best I've ever had. And I've had a lot. Pretty much everything was great. Don't be fooled by he humble decor. You might think its a dive (they should reconsider the logo but that's just me). Anyhow I promise you won't be disappointed. And if I sound a bit biased maybe I am a tad. I really want these guys to make it. Service was also wonderful. Freddy, the owner, really took care of us. And we walked in with sweats on. Ok so Mission folks head on over
author: Janet K.

description: Excellent food and service, very fresh seafood. The neighborhood is a bit dicey, but worth the trip.
author: Chris F.

description: I don' want to skew their score because I did not eat there.  Travelers should be warned that this is a very sketchy neighborhood.  I would definitely have gone there had I known to take a cab.  I was in a rental car with my wife and in a bad neighborhood that is unfamiliar to me and realized we would be leaving after dark and having to walk several blocks back to the car.  I wish I would have known and I would have just taken a cab and probably, by all accounts, loved the place.
author: Steve R.

description: I'm from OC and I come up to SF every couple months or so and everytime, I make sure to fill my tummy with some yummy fresh oysters before I head back home.  I wanted to go to my usual oyster bar but it was closed at the time so I found this place and decided to give it a  try.  Must've been good timing because they had just opened for lunch so we were the only customers.  The owner (I believe) was very friendly and nice and took his time answering our questions about the different oysters and gave some amazing recommendations.  We ordered the Mission Fried Special, garlic bread, Spicy Marinara Pasta, clam chowder, and ofcourse OYSTERS (lotsss of em).  Everything was amazeballs!!  The clam chowder was better than that one "famous" brand at Fisherman's Wharf but the oysters!!! were just mouth watering-ly fresh and good!  I don't remember all the names of them because we had about 10 different types that were mostly recommended by the owner or that he would just surprise us with.  The best part of it was the quality didn't match the price.  We had about 6.5 dozen oysters (all different price points) and all that other food but our bill was no more than $200 (including a pretty decent tip).  Definitely looking forward to eating here again on my next visit!
author: Ann P.

description: outstanding food, plenty of it, freshest fish, unpretentious atmosphere in a neighborhood that is getting too hipster for words.  just over the top best meal in a long while in san fran. it's my new "go to "place.
author: shotsy f.
